dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enclosed, fiberglass LIFEBOAT, 28 feet long - with 60 seats, and HATCHES fore and aft. It's steamy, hot, even a night. Floating on the Indian Ocean, 300 miles from Somal RICHARD PHILLIPS sleeps upright in this sweatbox, at gunpoint. He's 50, a career merchant mariner - now a host His captors are four Somali pirates: BILAL is 16, his lef foot wrapped in bloody gauze. ELMI is 25, has a three-col ROPE on his lap. NAJEE is 24. They're asleep too. But: MUSI, their leader, is wide awake. 25 years old, 5'9", ma 135 pounds. A rail-thin killer. His hand, bandaged and bloody, holds an AK-47 as he studies the sleeping Phillip After a beat, Musi rises, and "undogs" (opens) the AFT HA stepping out onto the lifeboat's tiny AFT DECK. He lays h AK at his feet, and pees off the edge. Phillips' eyes instantly snap open. Turns out, he was awa He assesses his options - IMAGES, hitting us in a hurry: Three pirates asleep; the THREE-COLORED ROPE on Elmi's la Musi's back turned to us; the AK on the deck... and SIX F FUEL BUCKETS, tied down in the boat's nose. It's time to So he rises, heads for the aft hatch. The rest is a blur:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The craft is orange, shaped like a submarine. Musi pees o its deck, the AK at his feet. Phillips can grab it and fi away. He considers that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a half-mile away, lit up like a distant jewel, is a U NAVY GUIDED MISSILE DESTROYER - the USS Bainbridge. 508 f long. Immense, powerful, here to rescue him - so... He pushes Musi off the deck and dives in. We FOLLOW: *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. WATER —- CONTINUING - NIGHT His glasses fly off, gone forever in the cool water. He starts swimming madly, moonlight shining through. Behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi surfaces, howling in Somali at his crew. * Next Phillips hears the engine of the lifeboat roaring to life. He swims, kicks, gasps... then he looks back. Oh no The lifeboat is coming at him, Musi clinging to its side. Phillips sucks in air, and DIVES down. Even underwater h hear the pirates shouting. The lifeboat passes over him, STOPS, idling right atop him. Phillips can touch its hull He surfaces beneath the bow - a quiet breath - grabs the ENGINE COOLING PIPES under the keel and guides himself al FOOTSTEPS on the deck above him. Pirates howling, enraged ducks under the boat again, comes up on the port side. But waiting there, in the water, is Musi. Oh shit. They lunge for each other's throats instantly. Hand-to-ha combat, just like that. Phillips gets Musi's head under water, Musi's scream turning into a burble of air. Holding the guy down - Musi flailing, kicking - Phillips trying to drown the bastard, until... another nightmare: POP POP POP. Three rounds from the AK, whistling past his into the water. He looks up. Elmi, on deck. Firing. It's over. Phillips releases Musi. That fast, Phillips is yanked out of the water by Elmi an Bilal, thrown through that aft hatch and back inside, whe INT. LIFEBOAT —- CONTINUING Elmi and Bilal throw him to the floor of the boat. Then t pounce: beating the hell out of him. Najee jumps in too. after shot, swarming like angry bees.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: We kill you! Kill you! Shouting, spitting, kicking. Elmi ties Phillips' hands to horizontal bar, exposing his torso. Bilal trusses Phillip feet to the base of a seat. He's helpless, a punching bag .+-as Musi, wet and enraged now, steps up. Silence... The

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: How much you worth, Irish? One million? Two million? CRACK. A right cross to Phillips' jaw, staggering him. No the others join in again: pounding, spitting, shouting... .».-until, gradually, they stop - too winded to continue.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You stay tied now, like an animal. And you pee in a bottle.  Phillips is a bruised, bleeding mess. Gasping...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I can't feel my hands. You trussed ‘em too tight.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Like an animal! Phillips tries to chew the ropes. Musi hits him again.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ropes can't touch your mouth! They are halal! He walks away. Najee and Elmi follow... leaving Bilal, th youngest, to stand guard, AK in hand. Bilal studies Phill perplexed. A long quiet beat... then he has to ask:

dialogues.speaker: BILAL
dialogues.text: Why you didn't just shoot us? (Phillips is silent) Gun was right there. Why you don't just grab it and shoot us?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I just... wanted to go home. Bilal doesn't respond. He can't. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAERSK ALABAMA is a cargo ship: 508 feet long, 83 fee abeam, displacing 31,000 tons of water. Massive. With a s story superstructure, "The House", rising from her stern. She idles, a_mile from the lifeboat... as she is boarded U.S. NAVY SAILORS - guys climbing up flexible-steel ladde from two NAVY ZODIACS idling beside the Maersk amidship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANE MURPHY stands at the helm of the Maersk, 120 feet a the waterline. He's Chief Mate on this ship - 27, tough a bouncer but with a Boy Scout face. From Seekon, Mass.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: The leader has a knife wound on his right hand, pretty deep. Another guy, he was the youngest, his foot's cut up - from glass shards. Murphy and 10 OTHER MAERSK CREW-MEMBERS (we'll meet them soon) are being debriefed by LT. PRICE, USN. ...as Navy SAILORS take control of this ship. An ENSIGN REID at the helm. Murphy can see the Bainbridge from here and that tiny orange fiberglass lifeboat. This sucks...

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is there some rescue planned? You guys gonna get him outta there?

dialogues.speaker: LT. PRICE
dialogues.text: Orders are, no offensive measures until the FBI Negotiator is on sight and in contact with the pirates.

dialogues.speaker: ENSIGN REID
dialogues.text: We okay to come about, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: LT. PRICE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Come about. Reid turns the wheel. The giant cargo ship turns. Murphy sighs; none of the crew-members look happy. Chief Enginee MIKE PERRY, (55, devout Christian) voices it:

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Doesn't feel right, leaving him out there.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PRICE
dialogues.text: Command wants this vessel out of hostile waters - we're escorting you all the way to Mobassa. The men hate that. Murphy studies them... then:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can we at least get word to his wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR NEWSVANS and 15 REPORTERS crowd the snowy driveway a street outside the home of Richard and Andrea Phillips. Underhill Vermont is a town with no stop-lights. But toda it's the center of the world, and Phillips is the reason. REPORTER, his breath fogged, does a remote from the porch ...as we PUSH INSIDE, through a window, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An 1830's design, timber ceilings. Messy and warm. But wh used to be a calm home is now Mission Control: NEIGHBORS, FAMILY MEMBERS - manning phones, monitoring CNN, fretting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We KEEP PUSHING THROUGH - faces, voices, a spilled soda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone patio, dusted by light snow. ANDREA PHILLIPS sits here, a brief moment of solitude amidst crisis. Behind he see a perfect Vermont pasture, blanketed white. Andrea is the one all those reporters want to talk to. Th wife. Lovely, fierce... but desperate just now. She stare an old NAUTICAL BELL that hangs over a clothes-line. Through the patio doors she sees her SISTERS, her SISTERS LAW, NEIGHBORS. All here to help. But none of them can. On her face, fear. Sadness. She lifts a CELL-PHONE to her ear, hits speed-dial. FOUR RINGS... then she hears:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (OUTGOING MESSAGE)
dialogues.text: You know the spiel. Now do the deal. I'll call you back. BEEP. Andrea starts crying. About to hang up... Instead:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: Hi, Honey. You're gonna have a bunch of hang-ups on this number. Sorry, they're all me; it's the only way I can hear your voice. Dumb, right? Richard, I keep thinking about the airport. Dropping you off like that. I always walk you in and watch the plane take off. Always. So why didn't I this time? I don't know. (a beat) The kids are good. They're both on their way home. Everybody's calling, even people we never talk to, guys I dated thirty years ago. I think they think I'm now available. (half a laugh, then:) Keep looking for me, Honey. Every night in the stars. I'm up there. And I'm looking for you. So I'll see you soon, right? I love you. She shuts the phone, eyes that old SHIP'S BELL overhead.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it! INT. LIFEBOAT —- MOVING —- RESUMING (NIGHT) This lifeboat chugs along, airless and fetid. Phillips, bound now, his face beaten and bruised, silent prays. Musi, on the bridge, watches, amused.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Hey Phillips, you turning Catholic again? (NOTE: the bridge is two steps above the lifeboat floor, nav and radio gear, two seats, and tiny cockpit windows.) The pirates look strained, edgy; Elmi nervously works tha three-colored ROPE: weaving strands of white, orange, and into a whole. Phillips watches with an unspoken dread.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I have to urinate. (mo one replies) I need the bottle. I have to urinate.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: No bottle.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You just said...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You pee on yourself, like an animal.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Won't be too clean.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I'm clean. My men are clean. No bottle. Two Captains, eyeing one another. The pirates watching...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: None of us are gonna get out of here alive. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Why? 'Cause of Navy? Don't worry, Irish. They not gonna hurt me. I work for those guys.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. This is a training mission. We take ships, see how the Navy does. Your company hired us. Navy guys and me, we're friends! Crazy bastard. He points at the Bainbridge, brightly lit half mile away, then chuckles. Phillips studies him...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We offer them beer! No American say no to beer! Beer and tv. Lazy, lazy. We're Somali Marines, we're 24/7. We can do anything. Najee picks up the three-colored rope, consults with Elmi about it in Somali. Clearly, it has great meaning to them

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That's for me. Isn't it. (Musi grins) The rope. Is it for me? Musi looks to his men: Do I tell him? A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Yah, it's for you, Irish. But you can't touch it. Your hands are lalil. Unclean. (relishing this) It's what we tie you up with before we kill you. So your soul never leaves these waters. Phillips digests that. Musi grins, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You had to pee, right? So pee! Pee, Irish! The pirates laugh. Phillips eyes them, defiant. You will break me... And he begins to pee, darkening his pants. The pirates start WHOOPING, celebrating, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea remains alone out here... until:

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Andrea? AMBER, Andrea's oldest friend, stepping on to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Who's been calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt Lauer, Katie Couric, Diane Sawyer, Senator Kennedy, Senator Leahy. But we didn't want to interrupt you...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: You could've interrupted me for Matt Lauer. Amber breathes out a smile, then drops a bomb:

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Honey, there are two people from Maersk here. Andrea sees them now, through the patio door: two CORPORA TYPES, a man and_a woman, just got here. Standing out lik sore thumbs in a room full of friends and family. She tightens. Maybe they're here to deliver bad news. Amb seems to think so too. She leads Andrea into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is suddenly silent, all eyes on the suits: ALLIS McCALL (blonde, pretty, likes her BlackBerry) and JONATHA HENSON (35, solid). They approach Andrea, who gulps...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Hi, Andrea. I'm Allison McCall. This is Jonathan Henson. We're from Maersk.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Okay. Bracing herself. Everyone in the room doing the same...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I'm going to be managing anything media-related for you. Jonathan's going to be liaising with the Defense Department, so you'll be getting steady and real-time information. Okay. She's not here to deliver devastating news. Everyon relaxes. A sister-in-law, NANCY, extends a phone as:

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Um. I have the Governor on the phone. He wants to know if there's anything he can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He can send over some State Troopers to move all the reporters off the road out there. They're causing a traffic hazard. Nancy pauses. Am I actually supposed to say that?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I'll be with him in a second, Nancy. Nancy nods, relieved. Andrea studies Allison, wary.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I appreciate your being here, Allison. But it's really not necessary. I know how things go. Maersk got their ship back, and all of their cargo, and most of the crew. That's a pretty good result. And sometimes one man gets sacrificed for the good of others. That's the sea.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Mrs. Phillips, Maersk is not going to let anything happen to your husband.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I see. Then how much are they willing to spend to save him? WHAM. That caught Allison flush. Andrea closes her eyes:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Richard, you have to save yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JOLT: Phillips is yanked out of a _ seat by Musi - sudd urgently. Rage in Musi's eyes. Something's infuriated him

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I want you to know something. We were all fishermen once. Other countries come and overfish our waters, dump all their trash here - no Somali government to stop them. So there's no more fishing. A few feet away, Najee and Elmi pull an ORANGE SURVIVAL S from a bin, and begin to spread it on the floor. Odd...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What's the survival suit for?  10.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: We were fishermen!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What's it for?!

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: If your body touch the floor, it makes the whole boat unclean. Oh. Musi loads a 9mm handgun, hands it to Bilal. The pira drop to their knees to PRAY for Allah's blessing. Game ov Phillips knows it. And he can only utter a single word:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Andrea... He shuts his eyes. We SMASH TO BLACK - and... Super: "Eight days earlier." FADE UP AGAIN: on Phillips, when the world was still sane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips is home. In bed. Studying Andrea's face as she sleeps - trying to sear the image of her into his memory. knows he won't be seeing that face again for a while. This is their bedroom: a four-poster bed, a crucifix on t wall, timber ceiling overhead. Messy and warm, with Vermo outside the window - a snowy pasture on a March morning. Andrea awakens. Phillips is the first thing she sees.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: (Barry White voice) Baby, when'll your husband be home? Andrea blushes, grins. She loves when he kids like that. Then the grin's gone, that fast - because she just rememb what today is. Instead, sadness. Resignation. These two l each other deeply. It makes the goodbyes awful.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: All packed? Phillips nods. We CUT TO... a different kind of home:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi awakens on a dirt floor in a stone hut. His wife, AB and their two kids sleep. He studies them fondly. RETURN  11. INT. PHILLIPS HOME - UPSTAIRS —- RESUMING Phillips eyes his daughter's room. (She's away at school) Every inch of wall space is filled with posters, bumper stickers, equestrian ribbons. They make him smile. Then his son's room. Lots of clutter, photos of swimsuit models on the walls - and the kid himself, just awakening now. DAN, A blow-up, 19. Phillips is angered to see him here.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Thought you were driving back to school this morning.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Woke up with a sore throat.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: (hates being lied to) Uh-huh. What time'd you get in last night?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It wasn't late.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Had to be after midnight - 'cause I was still up and you weren't here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You really gonna interrogate me, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorry. Are you still sleepy? (no reply) It's really simple, Dan. You go to school. Classes. That's your job. You're either doing it or you're not.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dad, you wanna boss people around? Do it_on the boat, okay? Jesus. that fast. Silence hangs...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You driving back, or aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Good. And check in on your mom while I'm gone. He HHH OK * + HH

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know the drill. * Lots of distance here. It makes them both uneasy. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea brooms snow off the patio, bumping her head on the SHIP'S BELL hanging here. Damn. She hates that bell. She Phillips descending the stairs, irritated, bags in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi's "belongings" lie in a corner, discards collected o the years: someone's sun-glasses, a chipped coffee mug, a book. He steps into some ratty sandals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a stone wall is a sliver of a mirror, too small to ref his whole face. He eyes a portion of his own reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toyota Minivan. Andrea gets in. Phillips beside her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take down that bell.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Please don't. It has sentimental--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I keep banging my head on it.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'll raise it, soon as I'm back.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: In July.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: In July. Not a happy reality. He takes her hand. It helps a little She pulls out of the driveway. Phillips looks up: There's Dan, glancing down from his bedroom window. Fathe and son exchange looks. That's it. *

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: He stayed over so he could see you off this morning.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't like him to miss class.  13. Departure days are always tense. And edgy. We RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdi hands Musi a gift, a homemade BRACELET of red cloth. smiles, takes it, kisses her. Then he goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underhill is snowy pastures, the local cemetery, a handma sign for fresh eggs, St. Thomas' Church. And a GENERAL ST It's run by MIKE WILLARD, (60, former merchant mariner), grins as Phillips makes his usual pre-trip purchase: 15 pounds of "8 O'Clock Coffee" beans, in bags.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE WILLARD
dialogues.text: Where ya bound on this one?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Salalah, Djibouti, Mombasa - delivering handshake food.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE WILLARD
dialogues.text: That's a good run. Andrea tightens. No, it's not a good run. Not lately. And Willard knows the tension well.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE WILLARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your boy gonna work for me over the Summer again?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Maybe sooner than that, he keeps screwin' around. (Willard smiles fondly) Can I get a receipt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi emerges from his hut... into a wasteland: Eyl, Somal No roads, no power or water. A goat ambles by, an old man with NO HANDS sits, staring. Musi walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airport. Andrea pulls up to the curb. Phillips pauses.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You're not coming in?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I can't today. Late for my shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. He lets it go, gets out. We STAY WITH ANDREA - as Phillip grabs his stuff, then walks around to her side of the car just in time for her to blurt out:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Two runs a year, Richard. That was our deal. This is number three. Is being away that great?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You want the speech about college tuitions and mortgages again?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I just want you home. Phillips knows that. He sighs, looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'll be right up there, like always. Right? (she half-nods) I love you. He leans in. She pulls him close, urgently, shuts her eye tight. Then her guard goes up again. End of hug. He smile

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Barry White voice again) Thanks, Baby. See ya next time I'm in town. She almost laughs. Almost. One last look, then he goes, * vanishing into the terminal. On Andrea's face we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi crosses a wind-whipped beach. No commerce here, no h just overturned BOATS. To his right is what used to be a FACTORY - abandoned now, rotting. Musi continues on... *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips emerges from a car in the port of SALALAH, OMAN. This place is booming - ships everywhere, big ones... But Phillips can see is the Maersk Alabama, ugly and immense. Huge CRANES fill her hold with dumpster-sized CONTAINERS. (She can carry 1,092 of them, but on this trip she'll onl carrying 400.) She bears no flag of nationality.  15. Phillips is instantly in Captain-mode: scrutinizing how t cranes are operating, how the ship's CREW is moving... Th

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Cap. Shane Murphy, the Chief Mate. These two respect one anoth

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You too, Shane. How's she look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find a beaten TRAWLER with TEN MEN aboard it: black, l hungry. At their feet: AK-47's, side-arms, ammunition. Th men are pirates. This trawler is their MOTHER-SHIP. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has two SKIFFS tied to its stern: motorboats. Not much amenities, but fast. The rest of this harbor is empty... Musi walks a rickety dock, approaching the pirate-trawler THREE CREW-MEMBERS see him coming. They stand at attentio Bilal. Elmi. Najee. Musi nods to them and boards the Traw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips walks the length of the Maersk, eyeing everythin He wears a blue Polo shirt, khakis, steel-toed boots. Behind him is the ship's "House", seven-stories tall, hom crew quarters, hospital, mess, engines, the Bridge... * Before him is the ship's massive HOLD, home to all those containers, (several marked WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME.) Anothe one's being loaded in. Shane Murphy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Seventeen tons of grain, wheat, and peas, bound for Kenya. (Phillips nods) Beats hauling Toyotas from Yokohama to Seattle, right? God, that's a shitty run.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Voyage Plan's got us sailing three * hundred miles off-shore. That's two * extra days. *

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Lotta bulletins comin' in about pirates last couple weeks, Cap. Crew's kinda edgy about it. *  16.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Yeah? Then why's security so lax * around here? (Murphy shrugs) Engine Door, Bridge Door, Cargo Scuttle - all of 'em wide open. I want ‘em secured. Even in port. Murphy nods. Phillips eyes the PIRATE CAGES (welded bars) that are supposed to be protecting the STEPS rising up se stories from here to the Bridge. They're unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pirate cages unlocked. What kinda crew are you handing me? Whoops. That was said just _as TWO CREW-MEMBERS walk by: RAIZA (26, black) and COLIN WRIGHT (30, Southerner). They just decided the new Captain is an asshole. That fast. *

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Off they go, unimpressed. Murphy waits 'til they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: They're okay. The Captain took his foot off the gas, last few days.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm puttin' it back on. Spread the word.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Cap, go easy. They lost a guy last week, outside Djibouti.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Lost him how?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Deck Machinist, twenty-year vet. Guy just opted out, middle of the night. Left a note in his cabin. "Tell 'em I went for a swim." That shit always spooks a crew.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Sorry, Shane - but I need ‘em un- spooked. And sharp. You on it?  17.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I guess I also need a new Deck Machinist. Murphy eyes him, sobered, then nods "On it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi touches the bracelet his wife gave him as we put to The Captain of this trawler is an elder named HUFAN. He h an old map, a radio, and some cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maps in here are electronic. The radar screens have d scrolling across them. The radios are fed by satellite. We're 120 feet above the waterline, looking out at the wo through massive windows. A bright, trouble-free day... Bu there's a tension hanging, even before we've left port. At the helm are KEN QUINN (2nd Mate) and ATM Raiza (whom Phillips pissed off on deck). This is hushed:

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: I'm just sayin', Coast Guard advisories say we should be six hundred miles off-shore.

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: You think a pirate trawler couldn't find a ship six hundred miles out? Murphy, ten feet away, needs to cut this off. So:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. We're screwed, Fellas. The guys turn... to see a sailor named DURELL (25, black, fit) who just stepped on to the bridge. Durell freezes. .»+.as the guys in here study him, like Pledge-Masters.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This your first ship, Kid? You right outta merchant mariner school?

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Aw, Jeez. We got an FNG, Boys.

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: Friggin' New Guy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Didn't they teach you it's bad luck to walk on to the Bridge left-foot first? Durell's eyes go wide. Murphy looks so serious. They all

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Write this down, Rook. Full moons and dolphins - good luck. Priests, redheads, fresh flowers, and walking on to the Bridge left-foot first, bad luck. Brutal. Now go back out and do it again. Durell freezes again. Really? He starts to back out... .».-when ATM and Quinn start laughing, big-time, which te Durell it's all a gag. He takes it pretty well. More laug Then Phillips enters - and things tighten. The laughs get choked back. He's the boss. And not big on goofing off.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Cap, this is Durell, new A.B.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Welcome to the sacred fraternity of merchant mariners, truckers of the ocean. Shane'll teach you the fight song later. We all set, Fellas?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY/KEN QUINN/ATM
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Phillips nods, heads for the coffee-maker.

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: Hey, Cap. I never been on this run before. Are the ports any good?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Askin' the wrong guy, Kenny. Cap never leaves the ship. Doesn't matter where we put in, he stays on board.  19.

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: That right, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm married and I'm cheap. What'm I gonna do on shore? The guys laugh. Phillips grabs a printed E-MAIL from "The Office of Naval Intelligence." Subject: "Pirate Activity the East African Coast." He eyes it soberly, as:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay then. Dead Slow Ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: Dead Slow Ahead. Quinn pushes the ENGINE ORDER TELEGRAPH (throttle), and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maersk Alabama puts out to sea... Slow but muscular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips moves to a computer - sends off a quick e-mail: "We're underway, Honey. I'll be seeing you in the stars." .»+.as Murphy eyes that bulletin from Naval Intel - about surge in piracy off the East Africa coast...

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: Hufan's men eat stale crackers while he monitors his radi Musi is thumbing through a weather-worn ENGLISH DICTIONAR memorizing words by the glow of a FLASHLIGHT... until he suddenly tosses the book overboard with disdain. Splash.

dialogues.speaker: BILAL, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Why you do that? All the ships we board, no captain ever speak Somali.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Everybody speaks AK-47, Bilal. EXT. MAERSK - MAIN DECK - STERN - AT SEA — MORNING A blazing hot day. Phillips walks the length of the ship again - his daily inspection tour - when he sees somethin Suspended above B-DECK - right where it should be - is th fiberglass LIFEBOAT. 28 feet long, enclosed, looks like a orange submarine, sitting on SKIDS at a 45-degree angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But ten feet below it, sitting on overturned buckets, are members of his crew: DEL and DAVE, old salts, each over 6 and overweight, smoking Marlboros. Phillips pauses, instantly irritated.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Enjoying your break, Fellas? They eye him without alarm. Or chagrin.

dialogues.speaker: DEL
dialogues.text: Sorry, Cap. I got a slipped disc.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Oh. (at Dave:) How're your discs? (Dave shrugs) Get to work. Christ. Aren't you guys supposed to be cleaning the lifeboat? And there's no smoking on deck. Del and Dave put their cigs out and rise, grabbing a hose

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Not a hose. Get up in a harness and soogee it, with a Turk's Head.

dialogues.speaker: DEL
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Yep. Hosin' it ain't the same thing. They eye the lifeboat, suspended above them. Hanging up t in a harness sounds like a hassle. Phillips turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, Cap. (Phillips turns back) We're spittin' distance of the Somali coast - got pirates takin' down ships right and left. How's cleanin' a lifeboat gonna help anything? Phillips can debate the point, or walk away. He walks awa

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Just get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Ken Quinn, eating. Phillips enters, irritated. He HHH HH OF

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Got some confused sailors on board, Shane. They seem to think my name's Maersk. I'm just the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You need me to tune somebody up, Cap? Phillips is about to reply when he sees ANOTHER BULLETIN the table: "Worldwide Threats to Shipping". ...it's sitting in front of Ken Quinn. Clearly, he and Mu have been discussing it. 23 pirate attacks reported off o East Africa in a single week. Now Phillips is really irritated - because a bulletin lik this should NOT be loose on the ship. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. I want you to show our crew a Goddamn map. He gestures to a MAP on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's Somalia. Here's Mombasa. Here's Djibouti. Here's us. Coast Guard advisories say we should be six hundred miles off-shore. Great, except you can't be six hundred miles away from Somalia if you're going to Mombasa, because Mombasa is sixty miles from the Somali border. You can go a thousand miles straight out, but you still gotta come back into range, because that's our destination. And by the way, these guys've hit ships twelve-hundred miles off shore, just like they've hit ships that are at anchor in port. These are the waters we're sailing. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy nods. Quinn too. Phillips seems calmer now.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Good. We're running a security drill today. Unannounced.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Great! I love unannounced drills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH HF HHH HHH HH HHH

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: In five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: ‘Kay. I wanna start out with--

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what you're going to do. Let's just see how we perform. INT. MAERSK - BRIDGE - 9 A.M. Colin Wright is at the helm. Beside him are ATM and a 70 old crew-member named MARV, (white, pleasant, but useless Phillips enters... and leans in to Wright, calmly:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: It's Colin, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: Yes, Cap. Colin Wright.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: There's a boat on our starboard side, Colin. Two men with weapons, acting hostile. Wright turns. Marv freezes.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: Ohhhhkay.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You have to do something about that - right?

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: Is this a drill, Cap? Phillips just stares: "Show me something." Wright rings t GENERAL ALARM, which sounds throughout the ship. LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Not the general alarm. We hit the whistle first - to let the pirates know you are aware of them and are ready to defend the ship. Wright nods, sounds a WHISTLE (audible five miles away).

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now the General Alarm. Long-short, long-short.  23. Done. ATM takes the helm. Marv still hasn't moved.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are...?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: I'm Marv, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Got pirates approaching, Marv. Hit the fire pump. There are two FIRE-PUMP lights on a console. One red, one green. Marv hits the RED one and moves away.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Red means off. We need it ON.

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Got it. ATM reaches over him, hits the green button... but:

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: The pumps aren't working, Cap. No water pressure.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Okay. Fix it. Marv, go secure the three bridge doors.

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Got it. Marv scurries off. Phillips watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys file in, without urgency. It's just a drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistles and alarms ring, but Del and Dave haven't moved.

dialogues.speaker: DEL
dialogues.text: Nice. Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm almost done. Relax. What's Dave doing? Using a key to scratch a caricature of Phillips, and the words "Philips is a shit", into a hatch door. A few last touches, then:  24.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. Now we can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips emerges from a stairwell: CREW-MEMBERS move past some with keys jangling on their belts. There are doors l unsecured. Not good. He spots a STEWARD, ambling by:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What's the non-duress password?

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: Mister Jones.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. That's the Secret Security Alarm code. Non-duress is "suppertime."

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: Suppertime. Got it. This isn't going well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy appears on the Bridge. Feeling some heat.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Have we switched the radio to VHF?

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: On it. Just then - Marv returns, winded.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Where you been, Marv?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Captain sent me to close the doors.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Oh. Which doors did you close?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Every door on every level.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Did they have locks on them, these doors?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Marv goes. 25.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: But you were just closing them. Not locking them. Securing them. *

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Um.... No. Just closing.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Which wouldn't do much good if we were under attack. Would it?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: No. I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: I've gone over this with him six or seven times.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Okay, Marv. Get to your muster point. (Marv's a blank) The Ship's Office. Go. «+» just as Phillips returns to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: We are in search of excellence - but * oh we will accept so much less. *

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How's it look down there?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Like monkeys trying to hump a football. Got watertight doors open on the Main Engine Level; they should all be secured, with deadbolts. Guys running around with key-chains on their hips. One set would give a pirate access to every room on the ship. That was in the Night Orders. Did we get the pump fixed?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's done.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's shut this down and bring everyone into the Ship's Office for a critique. Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: ‘Kay. Sorry about the screw-ups.  26.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Don't be sorry. Be angry. They'll jump higher. Murphy nods, shuts off the alarm. Phillips turns away. ...-when something catches his eye. THREE BLIPS - coming the 10-cm RADAR SCREEN. Odd. He stops. Leans in. The BLIPS indicate THREE SMALL VESSEL seven miles astern. They're moving in on us. Fast. Just like they would if this were the real thing. Hmmm.. Phillips grabs a pair of BINOCULARS and heads outside, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks through the binoculars, to find:

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS WATER
dialogues.text: Two MOTORBOATS pound through FOUR-FOOT SWELLS at 21 knots right at_us. A TRAWLER behind them. We can't see faces ye But they certainly are moving like pirates would. Real on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips lowers the binoculars. Collects himself. Returns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the Engine Order Telegraph, leans on it a bit gage tells us his RPM's just shot up to 122 revs. The shi surges forward. The men notice. He looks to Murphy:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Call down to the Engine Room. Tell ‘em to let me know if anything goes red. I'm increasing our speed.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Cap? We still in the drill? Phillips is already at a phone, dialing. Two rings, then:

dialogues.speaker: UKMTO OPERATOR, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: This is the Maersk Alabama - position is two-degrees-two north by forty- nine-degrees-nineteen east. Course is (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIPS (INTO PHONE) (cont'd) one hundred eighty, and speed at seventeen knots. We have two skiffs approaching at five-point-five miles, with a possible mother ship behind them. Potential piracy situation. That got everyone's attention. But it's still a drill. Ri

dialogues.speaker: UKMTO OPERATOR, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: It's probably just fishermen. But you should get your crew together and get your fire-hoses ready. And you may want to get the ship locked up.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: We understand that, thank you. Will keep you posted.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Cap? Phillips hangs up. The men await an answer...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Three boats. This is not a drill. Oh. He dials another number. Hears a ring. Then two.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Never heard of an attack in the middle of the day, Cap. Visibility's too good.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: They aren't here to fish. (hands him the phone) Take this. I'm trying to reach the U.S. Maritime Emergency Line. Murphy takes the phone. Phillips returns to the Bridge Wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another look through the binoculars. More DETAILED now: The skiffs are getting CLOSER, despite the four-foot SWEL Somalis. With AK-47's. (Musi and his crew aboard one; a pirate named ASAD and his crew on the other.) In other wo An actual attack, real pirates, coming at us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips returns - to find SIX SAILORS now staring at him  28. Ken Quinn, Durell, and Marv have joined Murphy, Wright, a ATM on the bridge. They look concerned.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Sea's helping us. They're getting pounded out there. But they are coming. Two skiffs carrying armed men. Four miles out and closing. Murphy lowers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Twelve rings. There's nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Colin, sound the intruder alarm. Wright hits the ALARM. Phillips grabs a P.A. MIKE:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO MIKE)
dialogues.text: Captain speaking. This is not a drill. All crew report back to your muster points. Repeat, this is not a drill. Crew to the Ship's Office. Engineers to the Engine Room. Locked up and sealed in. Now. (lowers mike) Shane, let's go to hand steering. Left fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Left fifteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giant TWIN TILLERS move fifteen degrees right, pushing th ship left - and creating a swell in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: AT SEA
dialogues.text: Musi's skiff SLAMS into a swell. He adjusts his course. T his right, Asad's skiff does the same. Zeroing in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips watches the radar screen. BLIPS moving in.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Right fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Right fifteen. The ship surges starboard. Phillips grabs the ship's RADI  29.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Chief, how we doing on engines? MIKE PERRY. We met him already - eight days ago.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: We're good, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Increasing speed to 124 revs.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: No problem. Phillips pushes the Engine Order Telegraph forward.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: They're at three miles, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: A lotta chop out there. Don't they know there's a lotta chop out there? Phillips eyes the radar again. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi bears down on the Maersk, his face a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks up from the radar. But Phillips already know

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Two miles, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Send out a call to "War Ship 237." I'll pretend to get it.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Forget it. I'll do it. He grabs the radio, speaks into it:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Warship 237, Coalition Warship 237. This is Maersk Alabama, come in. Then he changes his voice, pretending to be "Warship 237"  30.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ("warship voice") Maersk Alabama, come in. This is Coalition Warship 237. (normal voice: ) This is Maersk Alabama. Position is two-degrees-two north by forty-nine- degrees-eighteen east. Course is one hundred eighty and speed at eighteen knots. Request immediate assistance. We have two skiffs approaching and a mother ship trailing behind. Look to be pirates, heavily armed. ("warship voice") Roger that, Maersk Alabama. How many do you have aboard? (normal voice: ) Crew of twenty. No injuries at this time. ("warship voice") Roger that. We have a helicopter in the air. His ETA to your position is approxiamately five minutes. (normal voice) Copy that, 237. Maersk out. He puts the radio down. Murphy and Quinn eye him.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure that was illegal.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: So's piracy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the mother ship, Hufan just heard that fake transmissi He eyes the sky overhead for a chopper, as:

dialogues.speaker: AT SEA
dialogues.text: CRASH! Musi's skiff slams into a huge swell, almost upend His crew is sent sideways. Musi rights himself. ...then notices that Asad's skiff is now peeling off and heading away. (Asad also heard that fake transmission, vi HANDHELD RADIO.) Musi's crew-members look to him, waiting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses on, bearing down on the Maersk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips is watching all this. Murphy's at the radar.  31.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: This guy doesn't scare worth a damn, does he. (into radio:) Chief, you got your men secured?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: We're good, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: They're at one mile now, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Hit the hoses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE FIRE HOSES - one starboard, one port, three stern - quickly, each sending 100 pounds of water-pressure per sq inch off the ship. It's their only real line of defense..

dialogues.speaker: AT SEA
dialogues.text: Musi's got a six foot SWELL in front of him. His men brac themselves. He barrels right over it, then PLUMMETS... Big DROP. Big splash. The skiff's engine stalls. Musi tri to restart it. No luck. More swells are coming. He looks the Maersk - its hoses shooting HUGE JETS of water down..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips watching Musi. Murphy watching the radar...

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Holding at zero point nine, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: He started from too far out. They dropped him too far out. Through binoculars again, we see Musi, trying in vain to start his engine. No use. The skiff is adrift...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's dead in the water.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY/KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: Hell yeah! Awesome. See ya! Phillips looks through his binoculars again. Musi has binoculars too. Two captains, studying one anoth with a shared sense that they'll be seeing each other aga  32.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: We got lucky... Each Captain lowers his binoculars... as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent game of TRIVIAL PURSUIT. Murphy, Durell, ATM, Co Wright, Mike Perry. Guys trying to distract themselves. But Durell is kicking all of their asses in the game...

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me. Where'd you pull "The Treaty of Paris" out of?

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: College.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Hey, ya know those things that could bring a ship bad luck? Guess what the worst one is? The Friggin' New Guy winning Trivial Pursuit. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacious quarters. Phillips reads an E-MAIL from Andrea: "It snowed again today. I keep thinking how much you love that. And every morning I wake up on your side of the bed I must be missing you. Yes, definitely missing you. Miss voice. And I miss those great long LETTERS you used to wr to me when you were gone. E-mail stinks. Love you. Andrea Phillips breathes out a smile, looks out his window - a s full of stars. Then he STOPS. Just heard a BANGING noise. It's outside his door. He opens the door to investigate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the source of the noise: Marv. Slumped against a bulkhead, bottle in hand. Very drunk. Phillips sighs.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Marv. What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Trying to find my bunk. +e HH OH + FH HHH *

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. I mean on this ship. You should be home collecting a pension and raising gardenias.

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: And miss all this? (drunken amusement) "Being at sea is like going to jail with a chance of drowning." Mark Twain. He gestures wildly, shattering his bottle. Silence...

dialogues.speaker: MARV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Am I done?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're done. You can't sail with me anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Guess I'll get another ship then.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You do that. Phillips turns to go... but:

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: By the way... his name was Sam.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: The Deck Machinist who opted out... His name was Sam. Four kids he sent money home to, and an ex-wife. Who takes care of them now, huh? (Phillips is silent) Ship keeps sailing, I know; he was replaceable. But it woulda been nice if you'd at least asked his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marv turns to go - then stops, confused. Where am I going

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: B-Deck. Berth Two. Ya need a map? INT. MAERSK - A-DECK - MESS —- RESUMING The Trivial Pursuit game - the guys trying to forget the day's events... Then Phillips enters. He HH OH HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everyone tightens again. He notes it.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Who's winning?

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: Friggin' New Guy.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Aw, Jeez. Didn't they tell you that was bad luck? Tight laughs. Phillips grabs a coffee... the unease in he going unaddressed... until:

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Ya think they'll try again, Cap? There it was. Phillips pauses. The guys await an answer.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Most likely, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: And, uh... That gonna be the program again? Evasive maneuvers?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That's the book. Why?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: I didn't much like being outgunned.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Me neither. But they have weapons and we don't. So evasion's all we got.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Then maybe we should have weapons. A few guys nod. Clearly, it's been discussed in here toni

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Sorry. The guys who own this ship disagree, and they sign the checks.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: I don't get that, Cap. None of us do.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Ships start carrying guns, pirates are going to come back with mortars. We start carrying depth charges, pirates are going to come back with (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIPS (cont'd) rocket-launchers. Besides that, there are ports on this run that won't allow an armed ship to dock.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Careful, Cap. You're starting to sound like a suit.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Did have a corporate ring to it. Phillips looks to Murphy, who looks away: "Can't help you

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: If the hoses don't keep them away, we've got flares, pikes, axes, hatchets. We can gel the decks or wire the stairways.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: That's bringing a stick to a gunfight, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Hey, we get in a gunfight and lose, we could have twenty sailors killed or captured - huh? You all know the orders. If we're boarded, the crew gets to their muster points and we go dark and cold. Power off. Lights off. And we stay that way. Our performance today was embarrassing. And by the way, the non-duress codeword is "suppertime." Half the crew still doesn't know it. Unless you hear it, you stay sequestered. No one on this crew is going to be taken hostage.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Somebody's trying to hijack a ship, it goes against a sailor's nature to run and hide. We're men, ain't we? This isn't going anywhere good. Phillips reads the faces. .--and decides to stop pushing the company line.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You guys wanna know the truth? (they're waiting) The truth is, I don't feel any better about the hoses than you do. I wish we had machine guns. But I don't own this vessel. And I'm not in the game. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIPS (cont'd) (that landed) You wanna change the rules? Buy a shipping line. Until then, this is the job. We're here for the ship; the ship isn't here for us. Anybody who can't accept that can deboard at Mombasa. I won't think any less of you. Silence. No one replies. But he just gained some respect.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's shut this down. It's late. (out the door) We're still in apache country, so everyone stay vigilant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maersk muscles through the water. All is calm...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The two SKIFFS are tied to the trawler again. Musi and As stand before Hufan, who looks very displeased... then:

dialogues.speaker: HUFAN, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: The voices on that ship sounded American. Could be a lot of money. And we only have one skiff. (Musi and Asad, waiting--) Musi will take it.

dialogues.speaker: ASAD, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HUFAN, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Because he doesn't turn back. Then - BAM - Hufan shoves Asad off the boat and into the Splash. No one moves - everyone shocked, even Musi - beca the boat is pulling away. Asad calls out to Musi for help Musi is frozen, watching - as Hufan goes to the bridge an GUNS THE ENGINE. The trawler speeds away, leaving Asad in water. Howling. A point just got made. And Asad's helpless cries grow more and more distant... a INT. MAERSK - E-DECK - CAPTAIN'S QUARTERS - 5:25 A.M. Pre-dawn. Phillips sleeps. Then his eyes snap open - right before his phone rings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH OK

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: Better get up here, Cap. They're back. INT. MAERSK - BRIDGE - 5:30 A.M. Colin Wright and ATM are on watch. Phillips enters. «+.Just as a VOICE becomes audible on the RADIO:

dialogues.speaker: HUFAN, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is Somali pirate! Somali pirate! Coming to get you! A pirate? Announcing that he's coming? Very unusual. Phil looks to the radio; it's on Channel 16.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: They're five miles out. Phillips grabs his binoculars... and finds the TRAWLER, f miles astern, towing those two skiffs... but:

dialogues.speaker: HUFAN, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Somali pirate! Coming to get you! ...as Musi's skiff casts off from the trawler, coming at

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Let's go to one hundred twenty revs.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: One hundred twenty revs.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What's our course?

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Heading two hundred thirty.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Bring it over to one-eighty.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Left to one hundred eighty. A flick of the wrist, and the ship lurches left. Phillips keeps his eyes on the trawler. .»+.-as Murphy arrives on the bridge.  38.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We make a course correction, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Find out where the Bosun has his people.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Four point one miles astern. Doing twenty knots. Phillips gestures... and Murphy gets the picture: there's Musi's skiff, barrelling in on us over a calm, windless s

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call UKMTO, tell ‘em this is not a drill. Movement, tension. Phillips grabs the ship's phone:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Chief, we're in a piracy situation. I need you in the engine room with all your men. Locked in and secured. (a beat) And, Chief. Bring your Bible. This time you're gonna be there a while. He hangs up, heads for a cabinet, pulls out a PYROTECHNIC BOX. Eighteen FLARES in there. He grabs ten of them.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (re: radio) He says call back when they're within a mile.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Christ. Leave the line open so they can monitor what's happening. Sound the intruder alarm, and switch the radio to emergency band, Channel One. Murphy sounds the INTRUDER ALARM. Long-short, long-short. Phillips eyes the console. We're doing 16.8 knots.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ATM, let's start the fire-hoses and sound the general alarm. ATM hits the GENERAL ALARM. Phillips approaches Wright wi the flares.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take these and go out on the bridge wing. When they get within a mile you fire your first one. But I want you to cease firing if they get any closer than a couple hundred yards.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I can handle that, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. I want you below. Get the crew out of the Ship's Office and into the After-Steering Room. It's deeper inside the house. And make sure all the engineers are locked into the Engine Room. Every man accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: And Shane? That includes you. I don't wanna see you back up here. Murphy hates that... but he nods, exits the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIVE FIRE-HOSES begin spraying...

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING
dialogues.text: Musi's skiff is doing 21 knots. He shouts at his men:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Let them know you are here! Let them know you are Somali marines!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright aims a flare at the skiff, a half-mile out, when: MUZZLE FLASHES appear on the skiff. And just like that, w being strafed by automatic gunfire. SLAP-SLAP-SLAP. Bulle clang off the house and smokestacks. Wright hits the deck .»+-as Phillips leans out of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Colin! Get the hell in here!

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: I can hit 'em, Cap!  40.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Now! Wright hurries into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATM at the helm. Phillips grabs the ship's radio:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Shots fired. Shots fired. They're a quarter mile out. Port side. A rain of bullets: POP-POP-POP. Hitting various spots on House. Musi's skiff revs up and comes BEHIND THE SHIP.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: The hoses aren't gonna cut it. Are they, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. (into radio:) Shane, you got everybody secured? On Phillips, we PULL BACK, through the window of the brid .+-while TRACKING RIGHT and DROPPING DOWN, outside the "house"... until Phillips is out of frame, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move down and across the entire House, PUSHING THROUGH steel shell, revealing the innards of: E-Deck, then down through D-Deck, C-Deck, B-Deck... each empty, just unmanned Quarters. CONTINUE MOVING DOWN, into A-Deck, where we find the Mess, and the Hospital Bay. The the MAIN DECK. There's the Ship's Office, also empty. We keep descending, THROUGH THE WATERLINE, plunging in an down, until we reach: INT. MAERSK - AFTER-STEERING ROOM —- CONTINUING A STORAGE room, 60-by-20. Huge bundles of rope in coils. barrels of greases, oils, cleaning fluids. Murphy guides TEN CREW-MEMBERS in, hurriedly. We recogniz Ken Quinn, Durell. Murphy corralling them:  41.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: In, in, in! Let's go! Everybody in! Ken, get me a headcount. (into radio:) Chief. Your men all accounted for? We blow through a steel door - SAME CONTINUOUS SHOT - to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGINE ROOM is three stories deep, 130 feet long, wid the ship. Massive diesel engine, huge boilers, all run fr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nerve center. Rows of upright machines and monitors. Chief Engineer Mike Perry and his men are all here: the 1 ENGINEER, 2ND ENG., 3RD ENG., OILER, and DECK MACHINIST.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: We're in and secured. BIBLE in hand, Perry shuts the door. We END SHOT, and CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skiff is now just 100 feet away, on our port side. An Phillips is now on the bridge-wing, firing flares at it.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: Two flares miss, falling harmlessly into the water. Bilal sits cross-legged in the front of the skiff, grabs his AK aims right at us, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP POP POP. Bullets pucker the WIND-DODGER (a metal hood there to deflect wind off the bridge) over Phillips' head He ducks down. Then pops back up again.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: C'mon, Baby. Find a gas tank. He FIRES the flare, but:

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING
dialogues.text: The flare misses. Now Elmi, also cross-legged, is firing  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire - a TORRENT of POPPING SOUNDS around Phillips. An he's out of flares. He runs back into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, hollering:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Fifteen left!

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Fifteen left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship surges left, away from the skiff. .--but the skiff has found a spot amidship that isn't protected by the fire-hoses. Musi bears in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips looks to the GPS. We're doing 18.3 Knots.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Fifteen right!

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Fifteen right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship swerves right into the skiff. But Musi steadies Again, there's no fire-hose covering this spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, scrambling.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I need a rifle. We should have Goddamn rifles! Fifteen left.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Fifteen left. And yes we should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Najee unfolds and extends a LADDER straight up. Damn thin twenty feet long, Home Depot quality, with GRAPPLING HOOK  43.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: The GRAPPLING HOOKS wrap snugly around the FISHPLATE (sol metal, six inches high) on the deck of the Maersk. Musi grabs the ladder while moving at 18 knots. He jumps the speeding skiff to the ladder, climbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips grabs ATM, pushes him down, literally, to the fl

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Stay there. ATM doesn't argue. He'll steer the boat from down here. Phillips grabs the rest of the flares, heads out to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where he sees what he didn't want to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi is aboard. Running across the Maersk's deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips fires two more flares... They skitter off the de and into the sea as Elmi also boards the Maersk.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Two pirates have boarded. Two pirates aboard now, amidship. Oddest thing. Elmi sits cross-legged on the deck, just li before, and starts firing his AK, right at us. POP-POP-PO The wind-dodger puckers an inch from Phillips' face. He ducks down. Pops up again, firing wildly. MORE GUNFIRE drives him down again. Then: A HAND, grabbing him. It's ATM, pulling him away.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Get inside, Cap! They're gonna kill you!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Goddammit I told you to stay down! On the bridge! But more GUNFIRE strafes them. Shit. They crawl back to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MAERSK - BRIDGE —- CONTINUING GUNFIRE nicks the BRIDGE WINDOWS. (They're bulletproof). Wright is trying to stay calm. It's an effort.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: Whadda we do, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You two get to the After-Steering Room with the rest of the crew. (they eye him: huh?) Go. Both of you. I have the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Sorry, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: Can't do that, Cap. They aren't moving. Phillips isn't surprised. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that stands between Musi and the bridge is seven flig of steps - protected by that steel "PIRATE CAGE". He nods to Elmi, who SHOOTS THE LOCK OFF THE CAGE. The ca swings harmlessly to the side. Easy. They begin to climb. INT. MAERSK —- BRIDGE —- RESUMING Phillips knows they're coming. Damn it. He grabs the radi (NOTE: it will stay on his hip for the next 12 hours.)

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is the Captain. Listen up.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Perry and his Engineers come to a stop. And one room over

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Murphy and the rest of the crew do the same, listening.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're about to lose the bridge. Chief, you now have control of the ship. Shane, the men are under your command. I've got Colin and ATM on the bridge with me; I'm going to get them to safety as soon as I can. Everyone else accounted for?  45.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Yes, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Uh, no Cap. We don't have a twenty on Marv. Phillips sighs - but has to keep going:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Okay. You know the plan. We counteract everything they want to do. They wanna take this ship back to Somalia. That's no good. So we go dark and cold. Engines off, non- emergency power off. They can't do much with a dead ship. They wanna take a bunch of hostages. Also no good. So every man stays out of sight. NO ONE comes out until you've heard the all-clear from me, WITH the non-duress password.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Musi and Elmi, climbing fast toward the Bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips can feel them coming. And he hates to say this,

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do everything I can to make sure this doesn't happen - but if they find you, and capture you, here's what you need to remember: That lands on the faces of Murphy and the crew... And - in the next room - Perry, and all the Engineers, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi and Elmi, nearing the top...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, keeping it calm and direct:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do what they tell you. Try to appear helpful. You've got giveaways - use them: showing them the ship's safety equipment, or how to get fresh water. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIPS (RADIO, CONT'D) (cont'd) Make them feel they're in control while guiding them away from the important stuff, like radar or the engine controls. And never reveal the locations of the rest of the crew. If you are drawn into conversation with them, do not mention religion. Nothing about Allah or Jesus or your faith being better than theirs. They may throw politics at you or tell you America is the worst country in the world. Don't take the bait. You're not there to defend your nation's honor. You're there to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are listening. The pirates are climbing...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't call attention to yourself. Don't appear too confrontational or too meek. Maintain your dignity. If you're screaming at them or whimpering in the corner, you give them a personal reason to put a bullet in your head. Murphy, Durell, Wright, Perry... hanging on every word...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Last thing. A sense of humor helps. Unfortunately, none of you guys are funny - so try not to get captured. That broke a bit of the tension. But just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know the ship; they don't. Just keep looking out for one another. We'll be okay. He puts down the radio. ATM and Wright are silent. He gra JACKKNIFE off a table, pockets it... * .»+-as the sound of an AK-47, firing, spins our head arou The bridge-door opens - Elmi rushing in, pointing that AK us and shouting in Somali like a guy on a meth-bender. Instant chaos. ATM and Wright drop to their knees, hands Phillips stands still. He has lost the bridge, officially Elmi shouting. ATM and Wright scared witless. Musi glides meeting Phillips for the first time now:  47.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Relax, Captain, relax. Just business. No Al Qaeda. You stop the ship. Phillips nods. Musi looks the bridge over, notes Wright a ATM - shocked to find a black sailor here.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What nationality?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Me? Or the ship?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: The ship. American, right?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Yes. This is the Maersk Alabama. That's BIG NEWS. Musi nods, pleased. Elmi WHOOPS.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Okay. Just business. Stop the ship. Phillips nods, heads toward the ENGINE ORDER TELEGRAPH, w quietly keying his handheld radio and talking softly:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Bridge is compromised. Bridge is compromised. Take the steering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry and his Engineers just heard that. Perry hits a SWI that gives him OVERRIDE OF THROTTLE AND RUDDER COMMANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy speaks to his men (and into his radio):

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Okay. You know what to do. Kill the engines and all non-emergency power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarms are WHOOPING. Phillips silences them. Musi watchin

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: No Al Qaeda, no Al Qaeda. We want money only. Stop the ship.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. It takes a minute.  48.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Where's your crew?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm here with you. He moves to the Engine Order Telegraph. Jiggles it. Of course, it doesn't respond. Musi is about to complain, wh ..-with a SHUDDER, the thrum of the ship's engine STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, that fast, the POWER GOES OUT. Consoles, screens, A All dead. And we're adrift. Musi looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: We shut the engines down too fast. (pure bullshit) There's a check-down procedure. We rushed it, knocked out the grid. That pisses Musi off. Meanwhile, the ship is drifting wit the current, almost in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Stop this circling! Straighten the ship out! Phillips "tries", turning the wheel, to no effect.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: We shut it all down too fast! Ship's broken, ship's broken. He points to the console, taps on the bow thruster and th rudder angle indicator. None of them respond.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Move. Phillips obliges. Musi tries the instruments, futilely, a Phillips moves to the RADAR. Three knobs on it. He turns the "gain" knob and turns up the "anti-rain" and "anti-se clutter" knobs. Then he moves toward the VHF radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERGENCY LIGHTING down here - but Murphy can see what Phillips is doing on INDICATORS relayed from the Bridge.  49.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Attaboy, Cap.

dialogues.speaker: KEN QUINN
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Degrading the radar. And changing the frequency on the radio so they won't be able to contact their mother ship. The men like it. But they're getting warm in here. No A/C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bilal and Najee arrive on the bridge now. Shouting, point their AK's. Musi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: These guys are Somali pirates! Crazy. I'm just interpreter. (no reply from Phillips) Dangerous guys! They'll kill you! ATM and Wright keep their hands up and their heads down. orders Bilal and Najee to take positions by the bridge do

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call your crew. I want them up here!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Okay. Phillips moves to the P.A. MIKE:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO MIKE)
dialogues.text: All crew, all crew. Pirates want you to report to the bridge. Repeat, pirates want you on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semi-darkness down here. And HEAT. Murphy eyes the men.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Until you hear the word suppertime, we don't move. INT. MAERSK —- BRIDGE —- RESUMING Elmi pokes at Wright and ATM with his AK. Phillips steps  50.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Hey, do your guys want some water? Or some cigarettes? I got a couple cartons here.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Cigarettes. Phillips heads for a cabinet, grabs a few cartons.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: ATM, grab some sodas for these guys, all right?

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Sure, Cap. Phillips hands packs of cigarettes to Musi and his men. A grabs a few sodas, offers them to the pirates. Elmi ignor him, starts rifling through cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Hungry? (Elmi grunts) You're in luck. We've got seventeen tons of wheat and peas in the hold. It was intended to feed most of Kenya, but what the hell - go to town. Elmi didn't like that. Phillips sits beside Wright.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: (quietly) Cap, how much ya got in your safe?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Less than they want.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: But a couple grand, right? Maybe we give it to 'em and they go away.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: It's a U.S. ship, Colin. They're thinking millions - not thirty grand.

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: How do you know? Phillips just knows. Meanwhile Musi leans over the radio, trying to re-set it, careful not to let his frustration s  51.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What's your tribe, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm an American.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Not your nationality. Your tribe.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't have a tribe. I told you. I'm an American.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Your people. Your tribe.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Oh. I guess I'm Yankee Irish.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I'm a Somali Marine. A real sailor. The ship is still drifting in a circle. And Musi just ERU

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is your crew, Irish?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm here with you.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Get them up here now! If not, these crazy-guys kill you! Bilal and Najee jump as if they'd been plugged into a soc shouting again, pointing the AK's:

dialogues.speaker: BILAL/NAJEE
dialogues.text: Down! Down! ATM and Wright drop their heads, the AK's pressed inches from them now. Things just ramped up in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You want to die! Two minutes, they kill you! They kill your men!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Take it easy. I'm doing my best.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Minute thirty now!  52.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I told you! Bad guys! Bad guys! Wright looks to Phillips, who moves again to the P.A. MIK All he has to say is "suppertime" and the crew will oblig

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO MIKE)
dialogues.text: All crew, all crew. Pirates want you on the bridge now. Report to the bridge immediately.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: One minute! We kill everyone!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Can you back your men off, please? Before someone gets shot?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Get them up here right now! Wright, terrified, looks to Phillips - pleading...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO MIKE)
dialogues.text: Pirates want you on the bridge, right now.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
