dialogues.text: Thirty seconds! You hear me! Thirty seconds and you DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then men know to stay put. But it's now 105 DEGREES in he Del, the old salt, is panting from heat stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wright is about to burst. ATM too.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds!

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Dangerous pirates! Get your men!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You just heard me call ‘em! ATM and Wright, each with guns at their heads...

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Ten seconds!  53.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Call them again, Irish!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Hey. You wanna shoot somebody, shoot me. I'm the Captain. I'm the Captain. He moves in front of his men. Elmi pushes him away, hard. Phillips falls. While he's down, he keys his handheld:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO HAND-HELD)
dialogues.text: If you don't hear from us in one minute, we are gone. Defend the ship.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Five seconds!

dialogues.speaker: WRIGHT
dialogues.text: Cap? Please!?

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: We kill you all! Najee yells. Elmi and Bilal too. Deafening. Wright starts yelling out of sheer terror. ..-when a single unexpected sound pierces the air. A knock, at the bridge door. Everything stops. Every head turns. Musi nods to Phillips "Go open it." Phillips crosses to the door, opens it. Sig ..-because it's Marv. Of course. Right where he shouldn't Phillips can hardly believe it.

dialogues.speaker: MARV
dialogues.text: Cap?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: C'mon in, Marv. You're dead. Before Marv can reply, Elmi grabs him by the collar and p him on the ground next to ATM and Wright. But the crisis, oddly, has passed. Musi eyes Phillips:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Let's go. We search the ship.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: For what?  54.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Your crew. Phillips discreetly keys his radio, so this'll be broadca

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You wanna search the ship? Good. I'm eager to find those guys as you are. Musi pushes Phillips to the door, nods to Bilal.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: You too. Bring your gun. And that flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy heard that. He heads for a steel door.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Everybody stay put. INT. MAERSK —- BRIDGE —- RESUMING So Najee and Elmi will be left here with Wright, ATM, and Marv. Phillips pauses at the door:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I want your assurance that my men won't be harmed in any way. Musi pauses, breathes out a grin... then says something t Najee and Elmi in Somali. They nod. Then:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What'd ya tell ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Go. He nudges Phillips out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency lighting. Perry and his FOUR MEN (all in their and 60's), are sweltering in here. Murphy enters.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sounds like two of 'em are coming, and Cap.  55.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Way too much light down here; they're gonna find us. We gotta shut down the emergency power.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CRONAN
dialogues.text: That generator's on the deck, Shane. That's JOHN CRONAN, First Engineer. In his 40th year at s

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: His orders were we go dark and cold, right?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CRONAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. When's the "cold" part start?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I'm going for the E-PIRB and some water. Can you get to the generator?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Probably. Damn it.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Gotta kill the plant, Chief. That's the whole game now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips leads Musi and Bilal into a 65-foot-long passage When the door shuts, we're in semi-DARKNESS. Every fourth light lit. And we're adrift. It's spooky, even for pirate Phillips starts talking. Too loud. With his RADIO KEYED:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: This is E-Deck. You just tell me which doors you want opened.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Perry moves quickly - but quietly - up stairs. Ahead him is a door. He pauses here... then nudges it an inch: Sunlight spills in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, moving loudly, RADIO KEYED. Comes to a door.  56.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: These are the Chief's Quarters. (opens it) Listen, don't think too badly of my crew. They're good guys. I think they're just scared. Musi barks at Bilal to inspect the CHIEF'S QUARTERS.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Somali Marines, you tell them to do something, they do it. Nobody scared. (eyeing another door) They real sailors.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That's just a safety locker. Nobody in there.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Open it. Phillips opens the door. It is, indeed, a SAFETY LOCKER.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm not here to trick you. I wanna find 'em as much as you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy emerges from a STARBOARD STAIRWELL on to the Deck. Light sears his eyes. He squints, doesn't see any pirates here. Just an EXTERIOR STAIRWELL. He makes a dash for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, Musi, Bilal - searching this passageway:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: And these are my quarters.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What's that door?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That's a telephone booth.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry emerges from the PORT STAIRWELL. His eyes adjust.  57. From here, he can see across the deck. 50 feet away is hi target: the ship's EMERGENCY GENERATOR. Five feet tall, f feet long, ten feet wide. Green. But: Straight above it, seven stories off the deck, is a grate metal WALKWAY jutting off the Bridge. Elmi_ is currently standing guard on it, meaning he can s from here straight through to the Generator below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. Perry exhales, calculating the odds...

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: I've got the generator in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi enters Phillips' QUARTERS. He can't help but react. The place feels palatial to him. A large room, sunlit by windows. With an OFFICE and a SATELLITE OFFICE jutting of it. He begins to drift through, taking it all in.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Standard Captain's Quarters. Then we can drop down to D-Deck. Musi pauses. Before him is a MIRROR. Might be the biggest Musi's ever seen. He eyes his own reflection as if he'd n seen his whole face before. An odd, private moment. Then he notices PICTURES - of Andrea, and Dan, and Philli daughter MARIAH. Musi reacts; Phillips catches it.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have a family? Musi half-nods, looks at the picture of Dan...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When he was a boy and I had to go to sea, he'd stand in front of the door to keep me from leaving. He still kids me about it: "My father never loved me. He'd rather be on a ship somewhere." I think I'm gonna tell him not to joke like that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: My son says it too. That hovers. They eye one another.  58.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Ghedi.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: He gonna be a pirate too?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: If he live long enough. Then Musi heads out.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: There's a stairwell right at the end of the passageway here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy reaches the BULKHEAD beside that ORANGE LIFEBOAT. Affixed to the bulkhead by a bracket is an E-PIRB (Emerge Position-Indicating Radio Beacon) a 406 MHz DISTRESS SIGN red, looks like a walkie-talkie, with an antenna. He yanks it from its housing, activates it. It starts to BLINK and BEEP. Sending out a signal... as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Night sh A pup named FLOURNOY rises from his monitor, heads for a where DIETZ, his boss, is reading a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: FLOURNOY
dialogues.text: Boss, a call just came in from the Sarsat desk in Riyadh. They got a ping from an E-Pirb off the coast of Somalia.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: What kind of vessel?

dialogues.speaker: FLOURNOY
dialogues.text: American. The Maersk Alabama. Not a small piece of news. Dietz grabs a phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another 65-foot-long corridor. Phillips, Musi, Bilal. +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: D-Deck. Crew quarters. (re: a door) That's a closet.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Open it. Phillips opens the door. Just a closet. Musi eyes him...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn your English?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Open that one. Phillips nods, opens another door - revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATM Raiza's room. There's a PRAYER RUG on the floor. And ARROW on a desk, pointing to "Mecca." Musi stops. Bilal t

dialogues.speaker: BILAL
dialogues.text: Muslim? Musi throws a searing look at Bilal: "Quiet!" Bilal shrin

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I guess. (off Musi's look:) What, you thought we were all Irish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry closes his eyes, grabs the CRUCIFIX around his neck heartfelt prayer, then starts across the deck - racing fo that EMERGENCY GENERATOR, directly below Elmi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another corridor. Phillips, Musi, Bilal.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: C-Deck. More crew quarters.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: He the only Muslim in the crew?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't get into anybody else's business.  60.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You Christian?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Does it matter? Opening doors throughout, letting Bilal and Musi inspect.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I was Christian 'til I was ten. Yeah, you tell me what you are.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: If you really need to know, I'm sort of a half-assed Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Your children?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: My daughter's kind of on the fence about church. If it started later in the morning and served more wine, she'd probably go. (nods to a door) That's another closet. Again, Musi wants it opened. Again Phillips complies. And again, it's just a closet...

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Perry, running for that Emergency Generator...

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Murphy enters, sets the blinking E-PIRB on a table, heads into the KITCHEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi searches another small room, then stops: there's a p of NEW SANDALS lying here. He eyes them. Hmmmm. His sandals are old, ratty. But Bilal has no sandals at a Musi takes the new sandals for himself and shuts the door without Bilal knowing what he's missed. But Phillips saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry - unseen by Elmi, seven stories above - gets to the EMERGENCY GENERATOR. It has a lid, like a dumpster.  61. Perry opens it. Yanks a FUEL VALVE loose. Then throws TWO SWITCHES... and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden BLACKNESS. The Emergency Power just shut off. ..-and we're in a windowless corridor. Musi grabs the flashlight from Bilal, too quickly. It falls to the groun

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What happened? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Emergency generator must've failed. Musi gets to the flashlight. The beam hits Phillips' face The rest of the world is PITCH-BLACK. Drifting, creaking.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: How come nothing work on this boat, Irish?!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Bad luck, I guess. To their right is a door. We DRIFT THROUGH IT, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy is on the other side of that door, carrying the E- PIRB, jugs of WATER, bags of food. Now he freezes - as:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Crew's Mess. This is where we eat.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Show me. Oh shit. Murphy moves away as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»».as Phillips "fumbles" his keys, stalling... then he o the Mess-Door and pauses in the doorway. Here's why: The flashlight just hit something that shouldn't be here: A lump on the mess-table, a BLANKET clumsily covering the water jugs, food-bags... and the E-PIRB, which is blinkin Moving fast, Phillips takes the flashlight - as if to lea the way - starts walking toward the KITCHEN.  62.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You guys hungry? Got some melon in the fridge. You should take it, bring it back to your men. It's just gonna spoil anyway. Musi and Bilal follow, leaving the blanket behind. But:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy himself is hiding in this Kitchen... huddled under desk. Phillips spots the edge of Murphy's shoe, sticking out... but he keeps his poker face. In fact: He shines the flashlight on Bilal's bare feet - just inch away from the hiding Murphy, who notes them, as intended. Phillips opens the fridge. Of course, no light pops on. H pulls out four big CANTALOUPES, and some JUICE-BOXES. Han them to Bilal, who has the AK in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: (re: AK) Want me to hold that for you? Bilal laughs. Then gets another sharp look from Musi.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll find a bag. He grabs a bag, puts the melons in it. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This leads to the Hospital. He starts walking, in the darkness. Musi follows. Bilal t Murphy, under that desk, finally breathes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips leads them into the Hospital Bay. The flashlight beam reveals nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Where to next?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Engine Room. Musi grabs the flashlight back from Phillips. .»+-as Murphy, under that desk, tightens. Oh, no...  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 and pitch black. 65 year-old Del is barely breathing. The guys hear a tapped out KNOCK on the door. Durell open it. Here's Perry. He hurries back in, winded.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Everybody okay?

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: Del's in trouble, Chief. We gotta get him some air and water.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: Soon. Soon. Just gotta hang in there. Perry flips his RADIO ON - just as:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Chief, it's Shane. They're leaving the Hospital Bay and coming your way. Break some glass outside the Engine Room door. One of 'em's barefoot.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Copy that. Thanks, Shane. Perry eyes the men in here. They're fading fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips leads Musi and Bilal toward the Engine Room, wel aware that his crew is in there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Hang on, lemme just find the Engine Room key. It's hot down here...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: All your men babies like you?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: My men are merchant mariners. That had an edge on it. They step toward the door... when .»..-we hear a CRUNCHING SOUND, and a groan from Bilal; h stepped _on what we now see is BROKEN GLASS, by the door. The kid winces in silence. Musi eyes him, then looks to Phillips, "Open the door." Phillips obliges. They enter:  64. INT. MAERSK —- ENGINE ROOM - CONTINUING A deep space. Phillips pauses in the doorway. Musi waves flashlight. Bilal is on one foot now, in searing pain... .--as we drift just on the other side of a door, to:

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. AFTER-STEERING ROOM
dialogues.text: 12 men, hiding. Durell attending to Del. They hear:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where all your engineers?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I dunno. They could be anywhere. Durell looks to Perry, who quietly grabs a JACK-KNIFE... .+.as we RETURN TO Phillips and Musi - walking ahead of Bilal, who is too hobbled to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Why they don't come when you call, Irish? They don't like you? Phillips hadn't expected that. He pauses. ..-while his men, on the other side of the door, listen i

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Not much, no. I think they think I'm a prick. That landed - on the faces of Phillips' men...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What that word mean? Prick.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: A guy who keeps telling you what a horse's ass you are ‘cause he thinks it'll make you work harder.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Then I'm a prick. Good! (Phillips almost laughs) You treat sailors too nice, you get soft sailors. Lazy, lazy. Captain has to be a prick.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. He doesn't. It's just a habit.  65.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: If you keep 'em scared of you, maybe they sail better - then you don't have pirates taking your ship away.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That wasn't them. That was me. (a beat) I always thought when the time came I'd be able to outrun you. My mistake. The men heard that too. But Musi wasn't listening.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What's that door? Musi's pointing at the very door separating him from all these men, the AFTER-STEERING ROOM DOOR. Uh-oh...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That's a Haz-Mat closet. Musi weighs that. Bilal wincing. The moment just hanging. Then Musi moves on, choosing not to open the After-Steeri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: door. He just heads out. Bilal follows, limping.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We should get back to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive relief on the faces in here. Some gratitude too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATM, Wright, and Marv on the floor. Najee and Elmi on gua The door opens. Phillips, Musi and Bilal return - Bilal hobbling, bleeding badly. Najee and Elmi are silent, only because voicing disappointment would be insubordinate. But Musi can feel their anxiousness. It infuriates him. S

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: We go search again.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That's a waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: My ship now! Understand? + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs that FLARE GUN off a desk, and: *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here, Musi can see his SKIFF, bobbing gently aport. It's a tiny target, one that Phillips missed several time But Musi takes aim with that flare. A single shot... BULLSEYE. The flare hits. The skiff catches fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi returns. From here, all the men can see the SMOKE ri from the burning skiff. It's unsettling, for the pirates

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I decide! We look again!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You wanna find my crew? Then take these guys. He gestures to ATM, Wright, and Marv. Musi's thrown.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The crew's not gonna respond to me. I'm the guy they're mutinying against. Take them. Musi pauses, wary. Eyes the three crew members... then:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: (xe: ATM) I take the Muslim. Phillips sags; he'd wanted all his men off this bridge... Musi grabs an AK, yanks ATM up off the floor - but: *

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: They aren't gonna come out if you're * armed. * (Musi pauses) * It's a respect thing. They're * sailors. * Musi considers that, studies ATM - a long beat - then cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to Najee, handing off the AK and mumbling instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .--which gives Phillips a chance to mumble to ATM, out of Musi's earshot - while KEYING his radio: *  67.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Take him to the guys. They'll know what to do. ATM nods. Musi returns, studies ATM.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You really a Muslim?

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Then why you sail with these guys?

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: Why you sail with pirates?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: ‘Cuz pirates own the water, Brother. He grabs a LONG-KNIFE, and pushes ATM out the door. Phill watches, concerned but hopeful. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 a.m. Andrea sleeps. Outside, a cold WIND blows. Hard. She's sleeping through it... until the wind jogs that old SHIP'S BELL on the patio. It rings. And her eyes open. Fear, that fast. She knows something's wrong... We CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO HOURS have passed, in silence and heat. Tension hangi Phillips is removing the glass from Bilal's feet. It feel like kindness, but Bilal can't quite trust it.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Where are they? Where they go?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm here with you. (Najee grunts, irritated) Colin. Marv. Go look for them. Wait. What? The pirates eye Phillips. So do Wright and Ma

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My men know the ship. They'll find ‘em. And that way you guys can stay up here on the bridge.  68. A pretty bold play - and Wright's fairly sure it isn't go to fly. But Najee decides quickly... turns to Wright:

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: (re: Phillips) You no come back, he die. Wright nods, rises. Marv too. The pirates feign disintere .»-which gives Phillips a chance to say to Wright, quietl

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't expect to see you two back up here. Is that understood? Wright nods. Marv half-nods. They head for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 degrees now. Sweltering. ATM leads Musi.

dialogues.speaker: AT
dialogues.text: This leads to the Engine Room and the After-Steering.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I know the boat. Why you guys all talk so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATM's about to reply... when they both stop. Shocked. Musi's flashlight just landed on a FACE - Perry - 20 feet away. Perry ducks behind a corner. Musi starts after him. has to do something about it. He grabs Musi, but: Musi strikes him with the flashlight across the jaw and charges down the corridor. We FOLLOW... ...through this dark, tight space - just a flashlight bea and Musi's heavy breaths. Around that corner, when: A JOLT OUT OF THE DARKNESS - Perry, lunging at Musi with JACK-KNIFE, slicing into Musi's hand. Musi howls, drops h long-knife and the flashlight. ATM jumps in now, grabbing the injured pirate, backing hi against a bulkhead. Perry puts the knife to Musi's throat There's a RADIO on Perry's hip. He grabs it, flips it on:

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Hey, Pirates. Come in, Pirates.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pirates turn, deeply thrown. That voice, crackling through the RADIO overhead. Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the crew of the Maersk Alabama. We have your Captain. Phillips grins. But the pirates are irate.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you read, Pirates? We have your captain. Will trade him for our men... and for you guys getting the hell off this ship. The Pirates confer intensely in Somali... until it's deci that Najee will reply. He grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: You have our guy?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Bleeding, but we got him.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: We don't have a boat.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Take our lifeboat. On the stern. Najee lowers the radio, looks to Phillips:

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: We need money.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: It's in my room.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips opens his safe, extracts $30,000.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Thirty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: And how much you worth, Irish? How much a couple of your guys worth?  70. That had some edge. Phillips hands over the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lifeboat sits on those skids, above B-Deck. Anyone in it will drop from here, 45 feet straight into the sea. Elmi, Najee, and Bilal eye it, trying to look undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Need more fuel.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: We can arrange that.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: And food. Water. Phillips calls out... one deck up... to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy and Durell are one deck above the lifeboat, watchi

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: They want some food. Murphy looks to Durell, who nods, under his breath:

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: I'll go find something spoiled.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Pork. Make sure it's pork. Durell smiles, goes. Murphy leans over and half-waves to three Pirates, as if he were their best pal:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Food's on the way!

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: You show us our captain!

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Soon as you're in the water. Najee doesn't like it. Murphy doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Let's go get your fuel.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips siphons fuel from a DIESEL GENERATOR into bucket Najee stands guard. Elmi is a few feet away, flipping the same GENERATOR switches that Perry used to kill the power

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Will you please leave those alone?

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You trouble, Irish. You pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: No. More fuel.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Where ya headed? Disneyworld?

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: More.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Najee, Elmi, and Bilal get their first look inside the lifeboat: hatches, seats, the elevated bridge... (They do know it yet, but this will be "home" for the next few day

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Once you're in and secured, you're gonna hit this valve. Might take a few pumps. The cog releases, and you go down the skids and into the water. Najee should be nodding. He isn't. Something odd about th But before Phillips can react... he sees the caricature o himself, drawn by Dave. And the words "Philips is a shit. Phillips eyes it, breathes out an ironic smile.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At least spell my name right... The pirates don't comment. He moves on:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your food's here. Najee nods. Phillips steps through the AFT HATCH, to:  72. EXT. MAERSK - B-DECK — CONTINUING Bilal and Elmi watch as Durell steps forward with a box o FOOD, covered with tinfoil. Phillips gets a whiff, smiles

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Specialty of the house, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: Steward called it “horse-cock." Phillips grins. Murphy is ten feet away, glaring at the pirates. They're keeping a watchful eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crew holding up okay?

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: Couple heat-strokes, but they're fine.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: See that they get treated, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DURELL
dialogues.text: Why, Cap? You goin' somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Ya never know. That hangs there. He turns to the pirates:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Okay. Get yourselves harnessed in. We'll send your captain down to you once you're in the water.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: No. That halted things. Murphy waits. Phillips not reacting,

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You come in water with us. When we have captain back, you show him how boat works, then you go free.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: That wasn't the deal, Asshole. Najee points an AK right at Murphy's head, and:

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: New deal.  73. That fast, everything ramps up. Elmi points his AK at Dur Bilal, on one foot, points his at the guys on C-Deck. And suddenly everybody's barking - Somali vs. English:

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: crew-members ) Who you like least, Captain? Who you don't mind if they dead? More barking. More AK-pointing, testosterone rising - unt

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Belay that! All of you! The barking stops. We PUSH IN on Phillips...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (at Najee) Stop threatening my crew.

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: You get in the boat, nobody shout at nobody.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Then let's go. The pirates lower their weapons, heading for the lifeboat Phillips too. No one on the crew can believe it.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You're goin' in the water with these guys?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Send him down once we're underway. On the ladder amidship. Murphy's at a loss. The whole crew is.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How 'bout I go instead? And you stay on deck. I can show 'em how it works as good as you.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You buckin' for overtime pay now?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Cap, you get in there with them, you ain't comin' out.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: We want ‘em off the boat, right?  74.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But not like this. Phillips climbs in the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cap...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Crew's yours, Shane. You got it? A last look between them. Feels like a goodbye. Murphy no Then Phillips "dogs" (closes) the aft hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, sealed in with them now, moves to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Get your yourselves secured. This thing drops like a stone. The seats in here have harnesses like those on a carnival ride. Bilal, Elmi, and Najee strap themselves in, facing

dialogues.speaker: BILAL
dialogues.text: Hey, Irish. How come you do that? Your guy wanna take your place in here with the dangerous pirates. How come you say no?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm Captain. He's crew. Are you harnessed in? Bilal nods without understanding. Phillips grabs a radio:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: They can still strafe the ship, so keep the guys out of harm's way.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: How's his hand?

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Musi, bound and gagged, his hand bleeding profusely, has brought up to C-Deck under guard. Perry eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: He'll live.  75.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Okay. Releasing lifeboat now. Phillips puts the radio down, harnesses himself in, grabs RELEASE VALVE, (a hydraulic pump.) Starts PUMPING it, as:

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: A COG holds the lifeboat on these skids. Now it's receding, hydraulically... .+.-as Phillips keeps pumping the valve, eyeing the pirat

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: (quietly, eyes heavenward) God, if you have to kill someone on this drop, I'd appreciate it not being me... A few more pumps on that release valve, then: .+.the COG on the skids falls away. ..-and the lifeboat, unmoored, rockets down the skids. 12 feet, like a sled, nose down, then off the edge of the sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 45-FOOT DEAD DROP, hurtling toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates are stunned by their own velocity. Phillips braces himself. The surface rushing up to meet him, then: A THUNDEROUS PLUNGE as the lifeboat smashes into the sea, sending up a huge plume, vanishing under water. It's like a car wreck in here, bodies hurtling, banging, restrained by those harnesses. Water ABOVE us... until:

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. WATER-LINE
dialogues.text: The nose of the lifeboat breaches the surface, its bridge feet above the waterline, visible through those WINDOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips gathers his wits, looks to his passengers.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Cap, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: We're okay. Bring him amidship.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy on deck. Musi, hand badly BLEEDING, is beside him. The lifeboat - powered by a 4 cylinder diesel engine - pu up alongside the Maersk 20 feet below, idling amidship.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You go in, he comes out. Right? Musi smiles. The whole crew is watching from various deck as he begins to climb down his own ladder, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. LIFEBOAT
dialogues.text: Elmi opens the aft hatch, points his AK at the Maersk cre again. Nobody flinches. Musi keeps descending.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. LIFEBOAT
dialogues.text: Through the cockpit window, Phillips can see Murphy on th Maersk deck - but there's an ocean between them now. Phillips clutches the radio... then:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Listen, Shane. This ship is due in Mombasa two days from now.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: That's what the schedule says.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: I expect you to get it there. That lands. And Murphy doesn't like it. He watches Musi, descending, then looks to the open hatch, doing the math.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: I got a better idea. How ‘bout you jump outta that lifeboat, right now.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Can't do that, Shane. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Cap, enough of this already. Get the hell outta there. We can take these assholes.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Crew did a helluva job today; you did too. Tell ‘em that, okay?  77. Murphy's about to respond when... Musi INT. Musi look reaches the hatch, and climbs in - leaving it open.

dialogues.speaker: LIFEBOAT
dialogues.text: eyes Phillips, and Bilal's now-bandaged foot, (with a of mild scorn.) Najee quickly hands over the $30,000.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Not much to operating this thing; I'll take you through it. If you want me to fix up your hand there's a med- kit behind you.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Did you say goodbye to your men? So much for pretense. Phillips expected that.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Good. ..-which is when - no surprise - Musi grabs Phillips and shoves him to the floor, then throws the hatch shut, and guns the throttle, the lifeboat speeding away. The crew on the Maersk holler, but they're helpless. Phillips is shoved into a seat at gunpoint. No expression EXT. MAERSK —- DECK — RESUMING The lifeboat speeds away from us. The men watch it go, li

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You dumb son of a bitch. (sighs, then...) Okay, let's power up and run ‘em down. Full ahead, and hard left. The crew goes into action... We CUT TO: INT.

dialogues.speaker: BURLINGTON HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Andrea's in the middle of a shift (she's an E.R. NURSE) Checking a medical chart, when her CELL rings.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: This is Andrea.  78.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE WILLARD, (THRU CELL)
dialogues.text: Andrea, it's Mike Willard. What's the name of the ship Rich is on? And just like that, Andrea knows. Her husband's in troubl

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: What happened? Pure dread. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH COURSE
dialogues.text: Navy SEALS run on a beach. BRAVO PLATOON: 16 guys, ages 2 35. Warriors. Athletes. Patriots. Led by LT. SAYERS. A black SUBURBAN pulls up alongside them. Driving is LT. COMMANDER ROBERT ABOITIZ, (36, from East L.A.) Behind him THREE MORE SUBURBANS. The SEALS come to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: Need all your men in the trucks, Lieutenant. We have a situation.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: What's up, Boss?

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: An American's been captured by pirates off the coast of Somalia - holding him in an escape craft. Nearest warship is 345 miles out. (that lands) No calls to wives or girlfriends. We're briefing in the Team Area. Then we're geared up and on a plane.

dialogues.speaker: SAYERS
dialogues.text: (at his men) Okay, Bravo. Into the trucks.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A muggy fiberglass hell. Elmi checks the FUEL BUCKETS in nose of the lifeboat. Phillips watching. * Musi, at the helm, is dividing the $30,000. He gives hims all the 100's, splits the 50's among three other piles. * Phillips notes that too. *

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What's all the fuel for? * (no reply) * (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIPS (cont'd) Ya got five times more than you need. What's it for?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Protect us from other pirates. (Phillips is silent) Some other tribe come, try to take you away. We make big speed, then... He makes an EXPLOSION sound, laughs. Phillips eyes him. Musi opens the FOOD-PACKAGE from the Maersk. He smells it grimaces. Motions to Bilal, "Take the wheel." Then Musi o the tiny aft hatch - again, Phillips watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi tosses the styrofoam box into the water, then spots something... He stares - angered but not surprised: It's the MAERSK, fully powered now, on his tail. Musi duc back down, shuts the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING
dialogues.text: Musi eyes Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Thought you said ship was broken.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I guess they fixed it.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (at his crew, in Somali) Come get your shares! The men approach him on the Bridge. He hands each their "share" of the $30,000. It's bloody money, though. From t GASH on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Careful. You're bleeding all over my boat.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: My boat now.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Home. +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips feigns indifference; it's an act...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVEN NEWSCREWS outside now. 20 PEOPLE inside, here to he (TIMELINE: The Maersk reps have not yet arrived.) Nancy is manning the door - a REPORTER trying to get in..

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Um, this guy says he's a local reporter. But I don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Check his shoes. Is he wearing penny loafers?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: He's not local. No one from Underhill wears penny loafers. Close the door. Nancy smiles politely, shuts the door. .»+-as Andrea drifts through, talking on her cell with Da

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: We still don't know anything yet.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (THRU CELL)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna come home.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: No, Honey. You need to stay there. You've got your exams this week.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (THRU CELL)
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: It's a zoo here, Honey. Reporters all over. I want you away from it. (over him) Whaddaya think Dad would say?

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (THRU CELL)
dialogues.text: He'd probably say, "Do you know how much I'm spending on that school? Stay put and do your job."

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: Probably.  81. Amber approaches Andrea, holding a LAND LINE.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (re: phone) Andrea, it's John Reinhart. Chairman of the Maersk Line. Andrea pales. Maybe he's calling with bad news...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO CELL)
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, I have to take this; it's the guy from Maersk. I'll call you as soon as I know anything. It's all gonna be okay. I love you...

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (THRU CELL)
dialogues.text: I'm getting in the car. I'll be home tonight. CLICK. Andrea sighs, hangs up the cell, grabs the phone..

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: REINHART, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi, Andrea. This is John Reinhart. How ya holding up?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Just your typical April morning...

dialogues.speaker: REINHART, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: I understand. Listen, there's been a development - and I wanted you to hear it from me. We've gotten the ship back. The crew's fine. The pirates have escaped on a lifeboat. (dreading this...) But they have your husband with them. Andrea pales. Can barely speak. The room waits...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: On the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: REINHART, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes. It's a hostage situation. But you have my assurance, we're going to do everything we can to get him back to you safely.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I see. + eH  82.

dialogues.speaker: REINHART, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'm sending two of my best people to your home - to help you deal with the media, incoming calls, anything you might need. Would that be okay? Andrea can't reply. She can barely breathe.

dialogues.speaker: REINHART, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: Andrea?... Andrea? INT. LIFEBOAT —- MOVING - DAY 9 a.m. 105 degrees in here. Phillips sits, sweating. Baki Musi sitting opposite us, flexes his injured hand, pained

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That infected yet?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: How would I know?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Fever, shaking, vomiting, incontinence. Then it gets bad. Musi pauses, conscious that his men are watching.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're not gonna think you're a baby. They're gonna think you're staying fit enough to maintain command. Musi rises, gets the First Aid kit, hands it over. Philli pulls out eyewash, saline, bandages, a long roll of tape. Phillips casually cuts the tape with the JACK-KNIFE that' been in his pocket for two days now. The pirates eye him. Without comment he surrenders the knife... and unwraps th bloody shirt off Musi's hand, revealing a nasty-looking g He pours eyewash and saline on it, gestures toward Bilal:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Need to re-dress his foot too.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Why you so worried about him?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: He's a sailor and he's injured. +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Remember what I tell you about treating a sailor too nice?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: How're the sandals? They fit okay?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You trouble, Irish. Yeah, you a problem. They eye Bilal, nervously knotting that three-colored rop

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing wrong with him - he just afraid.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Yes. Of seeing my children starve. (no reply) We get back to Somalia, everything working. Tell insurance guys what we want for you, and everybody get rich.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Sorry. But I doubt it. (Musi waits) Why would the line pay you? They got their ship back, their crew, all of their cargo. And Captains are replaceable; don't you know that?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Only some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan is home now. He sits beside Andrea... and Amber, Nanc DAWN, JANET, PATTY (more sisters in law); LEA (Andrea's sister); Mike Willard; TEN OTHER NEIGHBORS. All of them looking at Allison - the Maersk rep - who sta in front of two ERASURE BOARDS. She shuts the tv off, and

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Okay. Rule Number One. No more tv. There are too many rumors bouncing around, and way too many opinions. From now on, we get our information only from the State Department, Defense Department, or from Maersk. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALLISON (cont'd) Everything that's confirmed goes on these erasure boards. Starting with this: the USS Bainbridge is on site and in contact with the pirates. There hasn't been an official ransom demand made yet. The Commander of the Bainbridge is taking his orders from a Task Force Commander, who answers to the Flag Officer of the Task Force, an Admiral named Michelle Howard. We are in touch with her on a regular basis.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Go Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: She answers to the Fifth Fleet Commander in Bahrain. He answers to the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who answers to the Secretary of Defense, and ultimately President Obama. All of whom are monitoring this situation closely. The President is receiving regular updates on the situation. If he feels a military response is required, he will give the go-ahead for a rescue. It's his call. Flattering, right? It is. So why'd Andrea just go pale?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Oh shit. (they wait...) Richard voted for McCain.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Phillips, in his usual seat. Then: THUMP THUMP THUMP. The sound turns our heads. It's Najee, trying to break a WINDOW ON THE BRIDGE with the butt of h AK-47. Repeatedly. An attempt to get some air in here.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Ya might ask him to stop that, before he takes your head off.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: He wants air.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: But he's still got the clip in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HH HHH HH HK +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi nods, then barks at Najee in Somali. Najee removes t clip from the AK, starts banging again... Finally, he breaks _a_ pane. A small trickle of air blows

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I have to urinate. Musi calls to Bilal, who puts down the rope, grabs his AK and - hobbling - leads Phillips back to the aft-hatch. Bi un-dogs it, and they emerge:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING
dialogues.text: Phillips steps outside... and his jaw drops - just saw * something huge, off our stern: The USS BAINBRIDGE, Guided Missile Detroyer, 300 yards aw Bilal smiles, thrilled. Huh? He pushes Phillips inside...

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING
dialogues.text: Bilal dogs the hatch closed. Looks to Musi.

dialogues.speaker: BILAL, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Navy here, Boss! U.S. Navy! *

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Yeah? Musi turns to port... and there it is, visible through th tiny cockpit windows. The Bainbridge. Instant reaction: Musi WHOOPS with excitement. Couldn't b happier. The others join in. Phillips is at a loss. As they yell and shout, Musi grabs the lifeboat radio:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Navy Navy? You got the pirates here! No military action! No military action! We not Al Qaeda! The voice of CAPTAIN FRANK CASTELLANO comes through:

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO, (THRU LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is the USS Bainbridge.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Good to see you! We not Al Qaeda! Need food, water, batteries, and more * bullets! Lifeboat out!  86. End of transmission. Musi laughs. His men do too. Huh...?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Why're you so happy to see a navy ship?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: We got an escort now - get us back to Somali waters, safe from other pirates! Everybody knows to stay away from the gray! (means it) You beautiful, Irish! You better than twenty hostages!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NAVY ZODIAC (inflated motorboat) skims water. Aboard it FOUR SAILORS, commanded by LT. KINIMURA, bearing a BOX of PROVISIONS. The Zodiac reaches the lifeboat, both idling. Musi opens the aft hatch, armed. Eyeing Kinimura.

dialogues.speaker: KINIMURA
dialogues.text: We want to see the Captain first, make sure he's still okay. Musi barks at Elmi below deck, who shouts at Phillips:

dialogues.speaker: ELMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come. Wave. Phillips appears in the hatch, waves at the sailors... th Elmi pulls him back down below. A beat... Kinimura's men hand over the provisions: a RADIO, batteri water, chocolate POP-TARTS. And, strangely, A-1 Steak Sau Kinimura pulls the radio out, hands it to Musi:

dialogues.speaker: KINIMURA
dialogues.text: Dedicated channel. My C.O. wants to talk to you again.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him later. Kinimura reacts, thrown. Musi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Old Somali saying: "You have all the watches. But we have all the time." He laughs. Kinimura doesn't. We CUT TO:  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ARMY OF REPORTERS is now confined to a church parking lot. They watch as a "COME HOME CAPTAIN PHILLIPS" sign is hung across the street. There are YELLOW RIBBONS everywhe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV, phones, 20 people here to help. Andrea drifts through FOOD PLATTERS are all over now. Casseroles, lasagnas, cak sent by friends, strangers. Serving trays are everywhere. approaches Andrea, bearing a particularly grand one.

dialogues.speaker: LEA
dialogues.text: This is from the local Somali community. They want you to know how sorry and ashamed they are.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: We have a local Somali community? Lea shrugs. Andrea looks around for Dan. There he is, by window, looking out at the snow.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You doin' okay? He shrugs, but the answer's no.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I was just thinking how much he loves the snow. If the temperature hits eighty, he thinks it's too warm. But he never complains about snow.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: He's gonna be okay, Honey. He's looking up at the sky, right now, just like you are - thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Or maybe telling the pirates how to sail. She breathes out a much-needed laugh. Dan too... but ther pure terror behind it. Andrea can see it; it's heartbreak She knows what to do. A few feet away is FATHER DANIELSON He's 50, their local priest - has been here all morning. Andrea takes his hand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH FH HHH OF

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Can we say one more, Father? Maybe all of us together? (Danielson pauses) Richard's so strong; I know he's hanging in there. But can we say one for the men who're trying to help him? Danielson nods, of course. Andrea grabs Dan, as we CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MILITARY TRANSPORT PLANE, 5,000 feet over the ocean. Inside, gear - weapons, comm, nav, scuba - all strapped i an RHIB (rigid-hull-inflatable-boat). The RHIB is secured the floor by cables, with parachutes attached to its ster -+-as 16 men stand, game-faces on. This is NAVY SEAL TEAM SIX. We move down the row of them, starting with their TE LEADER, Lt. Aboitiz. Then face after face, until we land Two Seals - PETTIS (black, future world-leader), and JOON (Korean-American, quiet.) A light above them goes green.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: Okay, guys. Time to hop and pop. The BACK OF THIS PLANE OPENS like a mouth. Wind rushes in GUILLOTINE severs the cables securing that gear-laden RHI ...and the RHIB rockets out of here at 120 mph, sucked ou with awesome force, its chute deploying automatically. No the SEALS themselves dive out. We FOLLOW PETTIS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falling, in darkness. Not a photon of light beneath us, ( waters of the Indian Ocean don't refract light at night.) Feels like an endless abyss down there. No form at all. But there's a lit ALTIMETER on our wrist, counting down.. 700 feet, 600... Our CHUTE above us. Then the RHIB hits w below us. A huge SPLASH. We keep plummeting, down... Then... a BIGGER SPLASH. That's us, submerging powerfully water all around us... then coming up again, to find: 16 men in synchronized action, SEALS leaving their chutes sink in the water and boarding the RHIB. The BAINBRIDGE appears now, coming to get us. The C-17 is long gone. We've just "splashed in," SEAL-style...  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COMBAT INFORMATION CENTER of a guided missile destroy icy blue lighting, a horseshoe layout of consoles manned 20 SAILORS, under the command of Captain Castellano:

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO
dialogues.text: Everybody vigilant. Game faces on. Beside Castellano is RICHARD GARRIDOS, an FBI man to his core, the only civilian on board. They turn as Lt. Aboiti enters, exchanging a salute with Castellano.

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Aboitiz, SEAL Team Commander. Richard Garridos, FBI.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: Sir.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS
dialogues.text: Good to meet you. Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: In place and ready to go. *

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. BAINBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Pettis, Joon, and EIGHT OTHER SEALS pass through a hangar containing two MH60 Knighthawk HELICOPTERS - as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Orders right now are, no offensive action. We just keep shouldering ‘em away from Somali waters. + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge RETRACTABLE DOORS open in front of the SEALS, reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fantail of the Bainbridge sits low and flat in the wa From here, the lifeboat is a tiny target on black ocean. SEALS drop their gear...

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Understood. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aboitiz, Castellano, Garridos:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS
dialogues.text: But that directive is countermanded * if the hostage is observed to be in * (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARRIDOS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: immediate danger. What kind of * surveillance do we have? *

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: We're right UNDER the lifeboat. And we aren't alone. * A team of SEAL FROGMEN are here too - attaching LISTENING DEVICES to the hull of the lifeboat. The devices are roun black, like hockey pucks. The SEALS activate them. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENSIGN is at a console, listening in on the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: We have good ears on the boat. And I've got sniper-killer teams surveilling from the fantail, locked in. +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS
dialogues.text: Those windows aren't much of a target. How're you gonna hit ‘em from the fantail of a moving boat? A few sailors react. But Aboitiz is unfazed:

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: A lifeboat riding bow-down on this ship's rooster-tail has a 17-second cycle of harmonic motion. At the half- point of every cycle, or at 8.5 seconds, the lifeboat will, for a brief instant, be steady on. As he CONTINUES, we RESUME INTERCUT WITH: *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five SNIPER-KILLER TEAMS, in pairs: RAMOS-WINSTROM; INGRA NGUYEN; SHRIDAR-KAY; REESE-HICKS; and Pettis-Joon. Four of the teams set up shop on LARGE CRATES, (a shooter resting his weapon on the crate, spotter behind him.) Pet lies belly down on a mat, on the fantail, Joon behind him The snipers have SR-25's. The Spotters have OPTICS DEVICE Through Joon's we see the lifeboat in the distance. Its windows look TINY from here. Bobbing up and down... Every SEAL sound-checks his NECK MIKE, as:  gl.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: During that lull, the scopes on a sniper's SR-25 can image their targets very easily. The first shot, a wad cutter, takes out the windows, removing all deflection criteria and giving four shooters, each on a single target, a clean line of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aboitiz and Garridos:

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ
dialogues.text: Any of our team members could then put three slugs inside the head of a quarter at 100 meters - although that is not the ideal distance. Garridos takes all that in, sold. Then: *

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS
dialogues.text: I'll talk to the pirates now, * Captain. *

dialogues.speaker: SAME, (NIGHT)
dialogues.text: Najee is finishing that multi-colored rope. Elmi is sitti up front, near the fuel buckets. Musi on the bridge. That leaves Bilal, guarding Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: How's your foot? Any better? Bilal shrugs, conscious of fraternizing with the hostage.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You stop talking to him. Musi, calling out from the Bridge, angry. Bilal tightens.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He already got one captain. Somali Marine don't need two. Phillips shrugs, turns away... looking through that box o provisions. Pop-Tarts, etc... until he notices something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of that bottle of A-1 steak sauce. Something's b written on it. By hand, in English - obviously a message for him by the Navy. Phillips reads it: *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Talk. We can hear you. USN." *  92. Oh. But Phillips barely has time to integrate it, when:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (THRU LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Pirate leader. Pirate leader. Come in. Musi turns, unmoved. But:

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. USS BAINBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Garridos, watched by Aboitiz and Castellano.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is the FBI. Come in. Musi's eyes just went wide. His men react as well. FBI. T VERY big letters. He regroups, grabs the radio:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: No F.B.I.! We not Al Qaeda! We talk to insurance negotiator.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Sorry. F.B.I. My name's Garridos.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: No military action! We want only ransom.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Okay. What'll you give me?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: We want two million dollars and passage back to Somalia. Then you get your man. Phillips watches all this... noting Bilal's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: What's your name? I'd like to know what to call you.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: You can call me Captain.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Okay. You and I will be working together until we figure this thing out. Tell me about your injury. And your crew-member.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: What?  93.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: You have a gash on your right hand, and you've got a crew-member with glass in his foot. Correct?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: I want to talk to the insurance guy!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: I have trained medical personnel on this boat, and a first-class hospital bay. Maybe you two come aboard and get treated. Then we can talk about things, face to face.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: I get it fixed when I get back to Somalia. We talk then.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: That's gonna be a problem. We're willing to work with you - but we can't let this thing reach land.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: We Somali Marines! We have right to go back to our country!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Not with an American hostage. Musi hangs up, angry. No one speaks. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Garridos for lifeboat. Come in. Musi grabs the radio again.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: No military action! We talk to Insurance negotiator! Two million dollars!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Look out your window, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: We going to Somalia.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Captain. Your cockpit window. Musi does... and he sees the five sniper-killer teams on fantail of the Bainbridge - aiming right at him.  94. It's just a moment - blink and you'd miss it - but all of bravado just vanished; and Phillips saw. Bilal saw too. M regroups quickly... Then, with utter control:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: We going home now. Stay away from the windows. He leans on the throttle, instant acceleration. His men d speak. But they know something's wrong. Najee and Elmi drift away, quietly. That leaves Phillips Bilal, out of everyone's earshot. Phillips studies the kid. Bilal looks away... Then:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Are you a good swimmer? (Bilal's a blank) ‘Cause you need to jump off this boat and get away from here, as fast as you can. Your captain's leading you to some very bad places.

dialogues.speaker: BILAL
dialogues.text: I never been anywhere else. That landed. Bilal walks away. Phillips sags. On the brid Musi starts singing a SOMALI WAR SONG. Loud. Off-key. Intentionally unsettling. And he keeps singing, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garridos, listening in. He takes off his headset.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS
dialogues.text: Captain, I need a chopper. Castellano nods, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea is in bed but wide awake. Amber sleeps in a chair. anxious stillness hangs. Then it's shattered: the PHONE RINGS. Oh no. Andrea grabs

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. MAERSK
dialogues.text: Shane Murphy, on the bridge of the Maersk:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Andrea, it's Shane Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi, Shane....

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: You doin' okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Uh, you know. Anxious. Flanking Murphy are some of the Maersk CREW-MEMBERS we no know: ATM, Durell, Perry, Ken Quinn, Colin Wright. Even M Dave, Del. Murphy's speaking for all of them.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: The Navy wouldn't let me call you before. We're in Mombasa now, as scheduled.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just wanted to tell you - we all did - we owe your husband our lives, every guy on this ship. He got in that lifeboat to save us, and you should be proud of that. He's a brave son-of- a-bitch, Andrea; and he's gonna outlast those guys, I know it. He'll wear ‘em down. Last we heard he was doing okay and in good spirits. So you stay strong, okay? He loves you. He'll get back home to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea just nods, a single tear rolling down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway. I gotta go. Still got a ship to run.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Thanks, Shane.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: If you talk to him before I do, tell him we all said thanks, okay? End of call. Amber takes her hand. We STAY WITH MURPHY: Through the bridge windows we see CRANES off-loading the Maersk's containers. She has docked in Mombasa now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NAVY GUYS are leaving. A NEW CAPTAIN, Phillips' replacement, comes aboard. Murphy nods politely. The show goes on - as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Phillips stands, wet and bleeding. His hands tied to the horizontal bar overhead, feet tied too. (We've TIME-JUMPED again: Phillips has already been beate for trying to escape. They've just made him piss himself. But there's now an AK an INCH FROM HIS FACE - held by Elm who pulls the trigger. CLICK. He's just dry-firing it, but the flinch from Phill made Elmi smile. The tenor in here has gotten meaner. Sic Najee knots that three-colored rope. Musi's on the bridge Bilal is silent. The lifeboat muscles along. ..-when, unsolicited, Phillips begins to speak:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: So it's the beginning of time. Adam's the first man ever. And all of his body parts hold a meeting, to see who should be in charge. Wait. Is he telling a joke? Now? Elmi can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Adam's heart says, "I think I should run things, 'cause if I stop pumping, he dies." But his eyes say, "Wait a minute, we think we should run things. I mean, without us, he couldn't see anything, or get around." Then his brain says, "I'm obviously the most important organ. I control breathing, thinking, everything." A real argument. No doubt about it; he's telling a joke. Musi turns, intri by the balls on this guy. Najee and Bilal too, watching..

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then, from down deep, a quiet voice pipes in. "Excuse me. But I think I'm the most important body part." It was the asshole talking. The pirates eye one another, mild disbelief and amusement

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The other body parts just laughed at him - get serious, buddy - and went back to work, deciding to vote on it in a couple days. (a beat) But the next morning, the asshole surprised them all. He shut down. Wouldn't let anything through. Breakfast, lunch, dinner - nothing. And pretty soon, the whole body began to suffer. The brain got foggy, the heart could barely beat, the eyes couldn't stay open. After three days of it they all came to him and said, "Okay! Okay! You win! You're the most important! We give!" Argument over. (eyes on Musi now) And that's why, ever since, all through history... it's assholes who have always been in charge. There it was, a huge fuck-you, aimed right at Musi. Silen ...-then Bilal can't help himself. He starts to laugh. El too. Then Najee. Even Musi finds himself chuckling. Phill too. Five strung-out overheated guys, laughing. -..until this boat is suddenly ROCKED by an unseen force pounding it, turning it SIDEWAYS. The pirates are knocked their feet - it's that violent. And NOISY, deafening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those NAVY KNIGHTHAWK HELICOPTERS is hovering righ above us - its rotors' GALE-FORCE WIND literally knocking lifeboat sideways. A pretty impressive show of force.

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING
dialogues.text: Musi struggles with the wheel, but it's useless. The craf isn't powerful enough to keep its heading.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What are they doing, Irish? Phillips keeps his eyes on those FUEL BUCKETS - sliding around. The wind keeps pounding us. And that noise...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are they doing?!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm here with you.  98. Musi, livid, guns the engine. But it dies on him. Now the powerless lifeboat is pushed in a CIRCLE by the w Spinning like a top, buffeted by air and noise. Musi's me dizzied, await his orders... as:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (THRU LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Garridos for lifeboat. Come in. Musi doesn't answer - just hits the ignition again. The engine won't turn over.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (THRU LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Garridos for lifeboat. Come in, lifeboat. We're spinning in circles, deafened by the noise - the Knighthawk literally sitting right on top of us...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your boat, Irish?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Now it's my boat again?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: What's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You baby, Phillips. Lazy American. Musi fumes. His men await a plan. Noise pounding. Sniper teams waiting on the Bainbridge. Everything closing in.

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. USS BAINBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Garridos, with Aboitiz and Castellano hovering:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is Garridos, Captain. You having engine trouble?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: You pull back now!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm just a guest on this boat. I can't tell the Captain what to do. But I can send over a mechanic to take a look for you.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Pull back! No military action!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Fine. What will you give me?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: I give you his ears! I give you his fingers! (no reply) I told you! I talk only to insurance man! Only to money man!

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm all you got. And we cannot allow you to return to Somali waters. We PUSH IN on Musi, all that noise bearing down on him, a

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: (ice cold) Fine. We die here then. He slams the radio down, looks at his men:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Finish the ropes. That sounded permanent, and Phillips looks shaken. We're still spinning, getting hammered by the rotor wind...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Phillips? You don't want to die at sea? What kind of sailor are you?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Like to see my wife again. And my kids.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: American sailors are all babies.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (THRU LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Captain! Come in.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Untie him. Elmi starts to untie Phillips, as:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Why don't you come aboard now? Get some medical care. We'll figure a way (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH OK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARRIDOS (THRU RADIO) (cont'd) out of this thing. We can set up a tow-line from our fantail, so you don't drift into hostile waters. We know there are rival tribes around here. Look, a gesture of goodwill: The noise suddenly STOPS, the chopper pulling up. SILENCE Somehow, that infuriates Musi even worse. He decides:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: Okay. We gonna kill the hostage now. Need a bodybag over here. Out. End of transmission. He marches toward Phillips - at the moment Phillips, untied by Elmi, falls into a seat... and narrative catches up to itself COMPLETELY, as: A JOLT: Phillips yanked out of the seat by Musi - suddenl urgently. Rage in Musi's eyes, infuriated by all this...

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I want you to know something. We were all fishermen once. Other countries come and overfish our waters, dump all their trash here - no Somali government to stop them. So there's no more fishing. A few feet away, Najee and Elmi pull an ORANGE SURVIVAL S from a bin, and begin to spread it on the floor. Odd... IMAGES, JUMP-CUT: Musi handing the 9mm to Bilal; the pira kneeling down to pray for Allah's blessing, and:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Andrea... He shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allison emerges on to the patio - to find Andrea, hiding again, alone against the snow, staring sadly at that old SHIP'S BELL.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (re: bell) He's so stubborn about things.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I'm counting on it. Andrea smiles. Allison sits.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your family's doing a prayer circle. You wanna come in?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: The Navy's not expecting a good result. Are they. Bam. That put Allison on her heels. She regroups, then:

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: The Navy's doing exactly what it set out to do - isolate the pirates and keep them from getting to shore.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: But they can't launch a rescue without getting him killed. And there's no way the U.S. Government could allow the pirates to take ransom and escape prosecution. So... (Allison's silent) Has anybody said anything to you about preparing me for the worst? No reply. The answer, obviously, is yes.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's not an indicator of our confidence in the outcome... That sounded lame, and she knows it. A beat passes...

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to come in with us? Andrea starts to cry again, can't quite hold it in.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I think I'll take a walk instead. And away she goes, off the patio and out into the SNOWY F beyond. Allison, helpless, just watches her go. From here, Andrea grows smaller and smaller. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: The pirates pray to Allah. Phillips watches, powerless... We CIRCLE AROUND him, his breath shortening, heart rate climbing - as these men pray for a blessing to kill him.  102.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You're not gonna get paradise and seventy-two virgins for doing this. You're just gonna get your men killed. Musi looks up from his prayer, his eyes lifeless:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Keep talking, Irish... That was chilling. Musi returns to his prayer, then gives order in Somali. The pirates get to their feet. Najee grabs that THREE-COLORED ROPE now, weaving it throu Phillips' hands. Carefully. We hear "Halal. Halal." We PUSH IN ON PHILLIPS - as he steels himself for one las stand. Just can't let himself surrender too easily. *

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Bring him over. Elmi grabs Phillips, starts to pull him on to the orange survival suit. But there's a problem, instantly: Phillips isn't moving. Huh? Elmi tries again - but Phillips digs in and puts his fists under his chin. Not moving.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No. Sorry. * What? They scream at him, livid.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You make hands-up posture now! Execution posture!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm not moving. Musi shouts at Elmi, who shouts at Phillips. Najee and Bi jump in too, Bilal pointing that handgun at him - as we:

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. UNDERHILL
dialogues.text: Andrea walks, all alone and shaky as hell. Then she STOPS And turns. Some instinct just told her to get back home..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates grab him and throw him on to the survival sui  103. But he won't stand still, or drop to his knees. They howl

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You make hands-up posture!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You going against the preaching!

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. PHILLIPS HOME
dialogues.text: 15 people form a PRAYER CIRCLE, heads bowed. We CUT BACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates try to push Phillips down, try to get his fis out from under his chin. But he WILL NOT BUDGE.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You can't go against the preaching! Four guys pushing on him, howling. But he just won't comp Keeps his fists under his chin... as we:

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. CAR
dialogues.text: MARIAH PHILLIPS, 18, drives too fast - blinking back tear Listening to NPR, a report about her father. Just get hom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips is kicking, twisting, defying, keeping his fists under his chin. Musi is shouting, spit flying.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You make the good posture! Hands up! You make the good posture!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea, running home. She steps onto an icy slick and los her footing, falling. She lands in snow. Damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 people, heads down, hands together, praying. We JUMP T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men of the Maersk - Murphy, ATM, Durell - huddled at radio, waiting for word. Mike Perry silently praying...  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips keeps resisting, fighting, kicking, never moving fists from under his chin. Pirates howling, spitting, unt THUMP. Silence. Everything goes white. Bilal just butt-ended him in the head with the handgun. Phillips falls forward, on to the suit. Everything foggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the ritual rug now. Certain he's about to die. Th pirates start WHOOPING again, celebrating... when:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Stop. (his men eye him) Look at the rope. Silence. The pirates examine the three-colored rope they' labored so hard to fashion.
