It has Phillips' BLOOD on it He SPITS on it, weakly, for good measure. Ritual spoiled. The pirates sag and drift away. Phillips is about to pass on the survival suit when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH VOICE, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Pirate Lifeboat. Pirate lifeboat. This is Reuters news service. Do you read? Reuters news-- We STAY WITH PHILLIPS, as we hear Musi answer:

dialogues.speaker: MUSI, (0.S., INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is pirate lifeboat. We are surrounded by warships and don't have time to talk. Please pray for us. Phillips' eyes begin to close. Then he's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's quiet. Andrea enters from the back patio, just

dialogues.speaker: MARIAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom? Mariah, stepping through the front door. Bereft. And bare visible behind all the food platters and gift baskets.

dialogues.speaker: MARIAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did daddy die?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: What? Why?  105.

dialogues.speaker: MARIAH
dialogues.text: There's never any food in this house! A beat... then everyone in here either starts crying or laughing. Andrea rises, crosses to her daughter. Mariah collapses in her mother's arms. Both sobbing. CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castellano puts down a phone, eyes Garridos and Aboitiz:

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO
dialogues.text: The President has given the okay. If we have a clean shot, we take it. Aboitiz nods. Garridos grabs his radio:

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Captain, you're in trouble. Let's talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi heard that. He eyes Phillips, unconscious on the flo We... END SEQUENCE. And DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day breaks, hot and flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking through a SCOPE at the lifeboat. Sunlight glints off one WINDOW. (The other was knocked out days ag REVEAL Pettis, flat on his belly. In position, as always.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIS, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: Boss, I have some minor glare, need a course correction. Please ask the Captain to go two degrees starboard.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (THRU EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: Roger that. Two degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi has spent the night working on the lifeboat's ENGINE goes to the Bridge. Hits the ignition. The engine starts. The sound awakens Phillips - still atop the survival suit his head aching. He looks up at Musi.  106.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: I'm going on the navy boat. To get our money. Not a small bit of news. Phillips studies him...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: It's a ship.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: The destroyer, it's a ship. A boat is something like this, something you can carry on a ship. Navy guys hate it when you call their ship a boat. Musi sighs: Do you ever stop fighting? Phillips shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: And we getting a tow. Bainbridge gonna tow us.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Then why fix the engine?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: They try any tricks, we cut the tow- line and go into their hull. Phillips notes the FUEL BUCKETS. They've all been UNCAPPE as if about to be turned into weapons. He considers that. Just then, a SOUND outside: a ZODIAC, pulling up. Musi tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Kinimura, bearing another BOX OF PROVISIONS. .»+-and a TOW-LINE extending from the fantail of the Bainbridge. Musi eyes it from the hatch, his face a mask. INT. PHILLIPS HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - 5 A.M. Still dark. Andrea awakens in a panic. Jumps out of bed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries down the steep steps, zeroes in on a sofa... where Allison sleeps. Andrea shakes her awake, urgently:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Allison. Allison. (Allison stirs a bit) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREA (cont'd) Please wake up. You have to wake up. I need you.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: What? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I blew it. I blew it! (no reply) It's Easter Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I could've done something. And I blew it!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Andrea, what're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: There's this homily Richard learned - from a Priest in Africa. "God is good, all the time. All the time, God is good." We say it as a family now; it's a tradition.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? It's Easter Sunday. Every Catholic in Vermont is going to be in church today. I could've asked our priest to spread it around. I could've had it said in every church up and down the state. I just wasn't thinking. Allison pauses a beat, her wheels turning... then:

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Let me work on this. INT. LIFEBOAT —- CONTINUING Musi gives some last instructions to Najee. Elmi guards Phillips. Bilal prays, Phillips watching...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: My wife used to go to church a lot. She stopped because I didn't wanna go. That's a regret.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: Maybe you start now. In other words, bow down and face Mecca. Phillips shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Can I have that, please? He's pointing to a CLIPBOARD, hanging on a nail on the bulkhead, a pen dangling from it. Elmi doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to write something - for my family.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: In case.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: What you tell them, Irish?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I dunno. Goodbye? I love you?

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. USS BAINBRIDGE
dialogues.text: Garridos, headphones on, heard that. Just as intended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips... almost broadcasting this to the Bainbridge:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want my wife to know that I'm sorry for the call she's about to get - and that I sailed all these years because I'm a sailor, not because I liked being away. And I'm sorry I was such a pain in the ass to my kids about school - I just, when it was my son's turn, I didn't want him to have to spend his life out here like I did, leaving his family seven or eight months a year just to make a living. It costs too much. I made mistakes; sometimes I treated my children like they were crew-members. (just realized) .--and treated my crew-members like they were children. I wish I could undo all that. He HH HHH HH HK  109. On the Bainbridge, Garridos is listening. Castellano too.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have to tell them that - have to make sure they know. Or I won't be clean. Elmi, nods, hands over the clipboard. Phillips grabs it, Bang. Musi knocks it to the floor, noisily. Rage in his e

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: We all have letters to write. He turns, heads for the hatch. Phillips calls out to him:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Did you say goodbye to your men? That was an echo - and an accusation. Musi turns...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Captain's supposed to be the last one off the ship - don't they teach you that in the Somali Marines?

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: Keep talking, Irish. And out he goes. Najee dogs the hatch shut.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: Why you talk to him like that?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I'm never gonna see him again. And neither are you. The Pirates don't know how to take that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TOW-LINE now connects the bow of the lifeboat to the stern of the Bainbridge, maybe 75 yards from here. Musi boards the Zodiac; it bears him away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates hear the Zodiac go. Phillips eyes them...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: (at Bilal) Listen to me. Get off this boat and swim away. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You shut up, Irish!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: It's over. Your captain bailed on you. There's no money coming.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: Why you keep talking?! Elmi tosses a rope at him, angrily.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. You tie knot. Like we do.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You tie it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sniper-Killer Teams are in their same spots. Four pai of men behind crates. Pettis flat on his belly.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (THRU EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: All teams, be advised. Proceeding to reel in lifeboat now. Beside one of the crates is a WINCH. The metal TOW-LINE extends from here to the lifeboat. The winch comes to lif beginning to pull the lifeboat closer. Slowly... as: Musi is helped up on to the fantail of the Bainbridge. He eyes the Sniper-Killer Teams. And that WINCH, slowly pull the lifeboat closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilt hits Musi, hard. He's led inside by two SAILORS... The SEALS behind the rifles never look up from their scop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmi slaps Phillips. Two ropes fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: That's lalil! The ropes can't touch!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: He cut a deal. He's not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You don't know.  111.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I know when he found a pair of new sandals he took them for himself and left your friend here barefoot. I know when he divvied up that thirty thousand he took all the hundreds and gave you guys all the fifties. That landed on Bilal. Elmi turns on him instantly:

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You don't listen to this!

dialogues.speaker: BILAL
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You want to be an American sailor? You want to be lazy and drink beer? Go ahead, go to movies with him. Be a nigger. Go ahead. Elmi shouts at Bilal - in Somali now - Bilal shouting bac both men rising -- a flashpoint, until:

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Shut up! They turn. Najee is on the bridge, glaring at Elmi and Bi

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (SUBTITLED, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here. The two pirates approach the bridge. We FOLLOW... .+.as they see what he's seeing, the TOW-LINE, tightening

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (SUBTITLED, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're pulling us in. Fear. Rage. Elmi and Bilal storm at Phillips, the MUZZLES their weapons inches from his face, that fast.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: Unclean place, Phillips. You going to an unclean place.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Fine. Long as I don't have to tie anymore Goddamn knots. ..-which is when we hear something new from them. They be to CHANT. It's low, guttural, ceremonial. A tribal chanti their bodies rocking a bit - much scarier than being hit.  112. They circle him, chanting. Bilal loudest of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pettis is flat on his belly, Joon spotting.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIS
dialogues.text: Tall Guy just moved from the Con. Report that in.

dialogues.speaker: JOON
dialogues.text: Copy that. Pettis has been in this position forever. We see a single bead of SWEAT trickling down his forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MEDIC re-wraps Musi's hand. Musi is silent, troubled... .-as Garridos enters, CLIPBOARD in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MUSI
dialogues.text: You never said tow-line would be pulled in.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS
dialogues.text: What're you worried about? You're safe. That was the deal, right? That sickened Musi. Garridos hands him the CLIPBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: GARRIDOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Standard plea agreement. As discussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chanting continues. Guns pointed at Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You move here. He gestures to a seat. Phillips moves to the seat.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You pick that up! He gestures to a cloth. Phillips picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You put it over there! Phillips does so - then stands up tall, sweat pouring dow

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Please let me write to them. Please let me say goodbye...

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: Military posture. Verrrrry good. The chanting continues. Najee nods to Bilal, who puts a BLINDFOLD on Phillips...

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE
dialogues.text: Animal! Lazy animal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That WINCH keeps cranking, slowly, drawing in the line.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (THRU EARPIECES)
dialogues.text: Line should be at 35 meters now. Advise, is that a correct reading? We hear replies from the SHOOTERS behind the crates:

dialogues.speaker: RAMOS, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: 35 meters. Alpha-Team check.

dialogues.speaker: INGRAM, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: 35. Bravo-Team check.

dialogues.speaker: NGUYEN, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: 35. Charlie-Team check.

dialogues.speaker: REESE, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: 35. Delta-Team check. ...as we land on Pettis, flat on the mat.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIS, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: 35. Echo-Team check. We STAY HERE, TIGHT... close enough to find that single b of sweat, now dripping down Pettis' forehead, near his ey

dialogues.speaker: PETTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: DJ, I've got some perspiration on my forehead. Need a hand with it. Joon, without a hint of awkwardness, wipes the bead of sw from Pettis' forehead. Pettis doesn't move a muscle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips puts his forehead to his shoulder, shaking the blindfold off. Elmi, livid, slugs him - puts it back on.  114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea, Dan, and Mariah at home. Tense silence... Then th phone rings. Andrea recognizes the number, answers.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Allison?

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: Put me on speaker. I want the kids to hear this too. Andrea hits the speaker button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chanting builds. But Phillips rises, shakes the blind off, starts walking toward the aft hatch. Huh??? *

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: What're you doing, Irish?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm going for a swim.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You sit!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: You sit.

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: We shoot you!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Then shoot me, you pussies. I'm out of here. He takes one more step before... POP POP POP - Najee fire the AK-47. Rounds ricochet off the ceiling. Phillips stop Silence. Najee eyes Elmi and Bilal... then:

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (SOMALI, SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: Cut the tow-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every SEAL reacts to the shots. We hear OVERLAPS of: PETTIS/JOON/RAMOS/ETC. Small arms fire coming from the lifeboat. Muzzle flashes on the (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETTIS/JOON/RAMOS/ETC. (cont'd) lifeboat. One shooter, automatic weapon.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (THRU EARPIECES)
dialogues.text: Affirmative. We have that. Then Pettis sees something that makes his eyes go wide:

dialogues.speaker: PETTIS
dialogues.text: Boss, we have movement on the deck of the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, Bilal emerges from the bow-hatch of the lifeboat, releasing the tow-line from the Bainbridge.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIS/JOON/RAMOS/ETC.
dialogues.text: They've cut the tow. Repeat, lifeboat is not in tow at this time. Everything ratchets up. The spotters and shooters adjust their scopes. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Najee hits the IGNITION. The lifeboat engine rumbles awak Phillips whips around - his eyes on those FUEL BUCKETS in nose of the ship as Elmi grabs him, pushes him back on to survival suit, knocking Phillips down to his knees. We he

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO, (THRU RADIO)
dialogues.text: Lifeboat! What's going on in there? We're hearing reports of gunfire and a severed tow-line. Come in. Najee grins. Bilal re-enters from the bow, shuts the hatc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on Allison, who holds up a CELLPHONE, to capture: ...an ENTIRE CONGREGATION, in unison:

dialogues.speaker: ENTIRE CONGREGATION
dialogues.text: God is good, all the time. All the time, God is good. Allison's crying. So's Father Danielson. So are many of t congregants. The homily starts again, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea and her kids, hearing it on the speakerphone:  116.

dialogues.speaker: ENTIRE CONGREGATION, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: God is good, all the time. All the time, God is good. It plays off the faces of the kids. Andrea grabs them:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: He's going to be okay. Your father's going to be okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmi ties Phillips' hands behind his back, RE-BLINDFOLDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»+-as Phillips bows his head, praying in earnest:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: (to no one) * God is good all the time. All the * time God is good. God is good all the * time. All the time God is good... *

dialogues.speaker: ELMI
dialogues.text: You think so, Irish? * Phillips sees Bilal, approaching the Bridge - then DARKNE

dialogues.speaker: NAJEE, (INTO LIFEBOAT RADIO)
dialogues.text: No problem, no problem. Just a mistake. No shooting. Okay? But he's about to ram the Bainbridge. Fuel sloshes out of uncapped buckets as the lifeboat floor vibrates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, all three pirates appear on the lifeboat bridge Pettis has his target, (Elmi), scoped.

dialogues.speaker: JOON, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: Echo has visual. Request permission to go hot.

dialogues.speaker: RAMOS, (INTO NECK-MIKE)
dialogues.text: Alpha has visual. Request permission to go hot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, bound and blindfolded, is on his knees on that orange survival suit - head down, whipped.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I tried, Ange. I really tried.  117. -..as Najee reaches for the THROTTLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musi, sick inside, signs the plea deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aboitiz looks to Castellano...

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO, (INTO MIKE)
dialogues.text: Weapons release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snipers ready. The fantail is still.

dialogues.speaker: ABOITIZ, (THRU EARPIECES)
dialogues.text: On my mark. Three, Two, One... Mark. FOUR TRIGGERS, squeezed at once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillips, head down, hears FOUR POPS. Uh-oh. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What're you doing?! What're you guys doing?! Then he hears a THUMP, close by. He shakes the blindfold ...to find Bilal, inches away, head-shot, dead. Elmi and Najee have dropped too, breathing their last - the boat's throttle out of their reach... Before Phillips can react, he hears two launches racing toward this lifeboat. That fast, the fore and aft hatches open. FOUR SEALS jump in, weapons ready:

dialogues.speaker: SEAL
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Are you injured?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I'm fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castellano gets word - and reports it:

dialogues.speaker: CASTELLANO, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: We have a good result. Repeat, a good result. Hostage is unharmed and in custody.  118. Game-faces vanish for a moment. The SAILORS in here CHEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Docked in Mombasa, Shane Murphy puts down a phone. Turns. The men of Captain Phillips' crew await word. Durrel, Per ATM, Colin Wright, Ken Quinn. Murphy eyes them, then:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: It's over. The men sag, deflated... until:

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pirates dead. Captain safe and sound. A cheer EXPLODES from the crew, the sound CARRYING OVER T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, Musi can hear those cheers. There's a mirror in here - big enough, once again, to rev his whole face. He eyes his reflection...

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: SEALS in the RHIB speed Phillips away. He fights off a te

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEAL Teams on the fantail quietly pack their gear... -+.as Phillips boards the Bainbridge. And he sees the guy who just saved him. Pettis. Joon. All of them. But these aren't men who want to be thanked. Or acknowledged at all So it's just a nod, from Phillips. Then the SEALS are gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Mariah sit on the couch. I-POD for her, a book fo him. Andrea smiles at them sadly, then goes upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea lies down, turns on a tv. There's a movie on. She settles in to watch it. Then her eyes go wide: There, across the bottom of the screen, a NEWS TICKER: "Captain Richard Phillips freed." She bursts out of the r  119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies down the stairs. Mariah and Dan turn, startled. .+.-JjJust as Allison rushes in through the door, breathl

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Is it true?!

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: It's true. Andrea throws her head back, grabs the kids. They're at a loss - but they hang on. She starts crying, as: ...the PHONE RINGS. Andrea's head snaps toward it. Her ey meet Allison's. Andrea gets to the phone, answers it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: (Barry White voice) Is your husband at home? At last, the call she's been praying for.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Richard?! Richard?!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIPS, (THRU PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi, Honey.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: OhMyGod! OhMyGod! Kids! They rush forward, listening in. Laughing. Crying. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA, (PHONE, CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Richard! What were you thinking getting into that lifeboat!? Phillips laughs, we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrea, Dan, and Mariah wait on the tarmac. A WELCOME HOM CAPTAIN PHILLIPS banner behind them. .»+.aS a private JET, provided by MAERSK, taxis toward th

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Mom. I can't stand here. Can I run?  120.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Run. He starts to run. Mariah too. Then Andrea. As we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another JET taxis to a stop. Doors open. Garridos and TWO FEDERAL MARSHALLS emerge... with a prisoner, in cuffs: It's Musi. No one here to greet him but more COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The private jet comes to a stop. Its doors open. Phillips emerges, jumps down the steps. They all fly into his arms A LOUD CHEER ERUPTS - as we reveal A THOUSAND NEIGHBORS, here to greet him. Everyone wearing a yellow ribbon. Big family hug. Phillips holding on tight, nothing said. CHEER CONTINUES, one thousand voices. He's home. And as that lands across his face we FREEZE FRAME... then FADE OUT...
